items.content:
Sales Director at Museum Hack

Remote

Location: New York 10001 United States

This position is remote. You can work from anywhere as long as you’re available on East Coast business hours, have a reliable working location + internet connection (not digital nomad), and authorized to work in the US.

No application phone calls or emails, please. We only accept resumes via our jobs website.

THE OPPORTUNITY

Museum Hack is a multi-million dollar business that believes Museums Are F****ing Awesome.

In 2018 we joined the Inc 5000 as one of the fastest growing private companies in America, and made the list again in 2019. We continue to grow. In addition to public tours and museum consulting, we provide corporate team building events for companies such as Google, Lego, LinkedIn, and Citi Bank.

We’re looking for an ambitious Sales Director with 3 to 5 years selling and sales team management experience to lead our Corporate Team Building Department.

SALES DIRECTOR JOB RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Work closely with our CEO and CMO to develop sales strategy, establish and reach ambitious sales goals
    • Strategies to include capturing repeat business, overseeing multiple brands, developing recurring revenue streams, + overall growing sales
  • Design + test pricing structure for new products to maximize sales close rate and profit
  • Track sales numbers and performance in CRM (Zendesk Sell)
  • Oversee Client Advisors within the Sales Department including:
    • Oversee performance and recruitment of client advisors
    • Create a strong and positive sales culture. Teamwork, empathy, and customer service are important to us in addition to strong results.
    • Coaching advisors to improve their close rates and average deal sizes
    • Rally team to hit and exceed sales goals
    • Recognize and remove any sales roadblocks
  • Operate as part of the Senior Management team within Museum Hack where you’ll work closely with marketing and operations to ensure alignment of initiatives
  • Love Museum Hack and how it transforms people into healthier, happier humans obsessed with these great cultural institutions.

PRIOR EXPERIENCE REQUIRED

  • Experience in B2B and enterprise sales (not a fit for retail sales managers)
  • Managing a team of 5+ sales reps including quarterly reviews, performance evaluations, hiring, training and firing.
  • Responsible for more than $1 million annual sales revenue and hit those goals.
  • Working remotely.
  • Proficiency working with technology. We use Google Docs, Google Sheets, Gmail, Slack, and many other web-based tools.
  • You want to help Museum Hack become the most successful cultural experience and team building company in the world.

ADDITION REQUIREMENTS

  • Authorized to work in the US.
  • This position is remote. You must have regular and reliable access to high speed internet and work location. This job is not for digital nomads.
  • You must have your own personal computer (with web camera for video calls) and phone.

COMPENSATION

  • $80,000 Annual Salary
  • Performance Bonus
  • Competitive Benefits package (insurance, PTO, monthly massage credit)

ABOUT US

Museum Hack is a creative company that offers irreverent, renegade museum tours and cultural offsites to corporate and private clients. Founded in 2013 and having grown to $2.8 million in sales in 2018, Museum Hack has uplifted the lives of tens of thousands of new museum guests. We work at renowned institutions and quirky locations in New York City, San Francisco, Chicago, Washington DC, and Los Angeles to bring these innovative experiences to companies and groups.

For a good overview, see our founder’s TEDx talk.

Museum Hack has been featured by The New York Times, The Wall Street Journal, The Washington Post, PBS, TimeOut New York, Huffington Post, TEDx, and more. Beloved clients include celebrities, schools, industry groups, and many innovative companies like Facebook, KPMG, YouTube and Chipotle.

No application phone calls or emails, please. We only accept resumes via our jobs website.

Apply for job

items.title: Intl Business Development – Biopharmaceutical
items.content:
International Business Development – Biopharmaceutical Partnerships at Invitae

Remote | International

Location: Anywhere

INTERNATIONAL BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT – BIOPHARMA PARTNERSHIPS

Invitae is a rapidly growing genetic testing company driven by the mission to expand access to high-quality, comprehensive, low-cost genetic testing. To support this growth, Invitae is looking to add a business development role to join our commercial partnerships team that focuses on global markets. Invitae has over 50 programs with biopharma partners and we’re continuing to expand, including internationally. This team member will be responsible for establishing and growing commercial relationships with senior executives at potential partners, including pharmaceutical and biotech companies across global markets. The role will provide strategic guidance on the growth trajectory of the commercial partnerships team , will be responsible for finding and following up on new leads, drafting contracts, conducting negotiations, launch planning and will play a key part in defining Invitae’s offering to international biopharma clients.

PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES AND ESSENTIAL DUTIES

  • Establishing and building client relationships with senior executives at international pharmaceutical and biotech companies
  • Collaborating closely with international sales team to pursue, identify, and follow up on new leads.
  • Drafting responses to RFPs, program proposals, and contracting
  • Conducting negotiations and completing the contracting process
  • Identifying and coordinating appropriate internal resources to support partnering discussions
  • Structuring and negotiating partnership agreements, including in cases where a creative and novel approach is required due to unique client needs
  • Providing guidance on the strategic roadmap for the commercial partnerships team
  • Managing relationships with existing clients and identifying opportunities to broaden our commercial offering with their international counterparts
  • Translating observed client needs into product development priorities
  • Coordinating with our implementation team on the execution of projects

EXPERIENCE AND CHARACTERISTICS

  • Fantastic team member with a willingness to identify and assume roles that drive the company’s success
  • 7+ years of experience in relevant international business roles, including business development or other roles in consultative selling with sophisticated partners
  • Excellent time management and organizational skills to handle and execute on multiple high priority deals
  • Demonstrated track record of building and managing relationships with senior executives
  • Eagerness and capability to engage with medical professionals regarding the scientific, medical, commercial and technological aspects of genetics
  • Prior experience in the pharma industry and/or genetics is strongly preferred
  • Network of contacts in the international biopharmaceutical industry is preferred
  • Language skills strongly preferred
Apply for job

items.content:
Business Development Coordinator at sMedia

Remote | Freelance
Business Developer Coordinator

sMedia is North America’s leading digital tech company for automotive dealerships.

Over 650 dealerships across North America partner with sMedia to build traffic, maximize engagement, and drive leads and sales.

We analyze website visitors online body language for buying intent, predict future sales from future behavior, and deploy proprietary AI – driven advertising to increase dealership sales.

This position is a part time (freelance) position starting at 15-20 hours per week and we are open to remote applicants. Our general calling hours are between 8 AM & 5 PM, Monday through Friday. 

Responsibilities:
  • Support our Dealer Specialist team by initiating contact (via phone) with prospective customers to generate leads (dealerships throughout North America)
  • Call using scripts to provide information about sMedia, our solutions and how they can benefit the dealership
  • Set up demos for the Dealer Specialist team through google calendar and calend.ly
  • Strive to provide every potential customer with a great experience when working with them
  • Establishing effective relationships with potential customers via phone and email
  • Handling general inquiries and provide appropriate feedback to the Dealer Specialists
Skills & Qualifications:
  • Tech Savvy,  needs to be able to operate in a fast paced tech space
  • Great personality and comfortable on the phone cold calling potential customers
  • Strong communication skills
  • Previous sales experience an asset
  • Strong listening skills
  • Strong customer relationship skills with excellent verbal and written skills
  • Highly organized with great attention to detail
  • Automotive and dealership experience preferred
What It Means To Be Successful In This Position?
  • Make active contributions to achieve team goals and successes
  • Proactive Approach – self starter that finds ways to increase efficiencies
  • Strong team player, ability to build positive and collaborative relationships within the organization and with customer personnel

Locations: Canada, United States, England, Australia
Apply to: stephanie@smedia.ca

Apply for job

We are recruiting a team of experienced Presales Consultants with strong SAP AMS experienceto join our global client. The ideal candidate will be based in Europe with the option to work remotely.

The right candidate will be tasked with the following

Daily Tasks:

  • Management & coordination of quotation teams for the development of customer specific approaches (big management)

Key skills:

  • Strong interpersonal skills with a confident can-do attitude
  • Experience working in a pre-sales environment within SAP AMS solutions
  • At least 3-5 years of professional experience in SAP consulting or module support
  • Customer-oriented thinking and acting
  • Strong team work skills and load carrying capacity
  • Fluent written & spoken English is essential
  • Candidates must be willing to travel internationally regularly
  • Ideally candidates will have successfully completed a degree in business informatics, business sciences or a comparable qualification

If this interests you and you are available now (or very soon) then please get in touch ASAP with an up to date CV & contact details.

Start: ASAP

Job Type: Permanent

Salary: Up to 85,000 EUR per annum (all inclusive)

Location: Remote work available with regular travel within Europe

items.title: CVEDIA: Business Development Representative Fully Remote Full Time
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=22, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Business Development Representative Fully Remote Full Time

CVEDIA is a funded AI company that develops deep learning solutions for some of the largest organizations on the planet. We develop and license solutions for computer vision systems. CVEDIA is seeking an ambitious and intelligent Business Development Representative to contribute to our growth. This position will be responsible for developing new business across verticals including ADAS/AD, Agricultural, Industrial and Infrastructure.

In this role, you will have the opportunity of working in a team of exceptionally talented and driven individuals who are all making a massive impact on our business. There is no micromanaging or babysitting at CVEDIA, everyone here drives their own ideas all the way from start to finish, everyone is given an equal opportunity to flourish and see the fruits of their labour.

Responsibilities Include


  • Creative prospecting for new markets, accounts and leads
  • Managing and optimize the inbound lead pipeline
  • Active cold outreach to targeted accounts
  • Collaborating with internal stakeholders and customers to recognize and develop new market opportunities
  • Maintaining a high level of attention to detail and precision in communication

Key Qualifications Include


  • Passion for working in a fully virtually distributed remote startup environment
  • Enthusiasm to contribute to a rapidly growing and innovative company culture
  • Intelligence and ability to quickly establish credibility with a technical buyer

What We Offer


  • Fully distributed team, located in 19 countries
  • 4 weeks paid holiday per year
  • Yearly team meetup - this year we went to Portugal!
  • Anti-discriminatory company culture - we won’t discount you for things like needing to pick your kids up from school, your age, your ethnicity, or your gender
  • An excited, communicative, and helpful team - we keep our work environment positive, but we also place importance on honesty

Our Values

1. Passion - We need both energy and passion to develop cutting edge AI. To succeed at CVEDIA, you’ll need to have a strong investment in both your career and the role of AI in the future of the planet.

2. Commitment - CVEDIA has the opposite of a "quick-n-dirty" mentality. Every aspect of our technology has been meticulously built, and is always the product of very hard work.

3. Autonomy - Carrying confidence in the work we do individually is required to work at the pace that we do as a team. Academic research, tutorials, and even creating our own solutions with the tools we have are all on the board during a regular day's work.

4. Joy - It's one of our greatest strengths to bring joy and excitement into our workplace. We carry this energy into meetings, project planning, and our dedication to our work, and focus on work that feels meaningful.

5. Communication - Honest discussions are imperative to the flow of work and ideas. Team members need to be able to effectively communicate complex ideas to those who don’t work in their field. It's a regular occurrence to spontaneously discuss plans and ideas with any team member on the fly, including our CEO or CTO. Each team member is respected equally and acts as a valuable contributor.



How to Apply


  • Please state in the subject the job position you are applying for
  • Please mention your city and country of residence in your application
  • English applications only - a professional speaking and writing command of English is required for this role
  • Due to time zone difficulties, we’re currently only accepting applicants in North America or European timezones.

For more information about us and videos of our work, please check out CVEDIA.COM

items.title: Sales Accociate
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Sales Associate
 


Our company


Settled was founded to revolutionise the way we buy and sell homes in the UK. We’re on a mission to fix the broken process and making moving home joyful, by building next-generation technology and unrivalled service. 


As well as being led by a former Google exec, Settled is venture capital-backed by firms including 500 Startups, Piton Capital, Accelerated Digital Ventures and Connect Ventures. We’re at that exciting stage where we’re small (and mighty), and we’re gearing up for exponential growth. If you’re up for that, read on!


People are at the heart of everything we do, and we spend a lot of time thinking about our team and our culture. We love working with smart, creative thinkers who are passionate about collaborating and making a difference.


 


The Role


The overall purpose of the Sales Executive is to approach very targeted prospects we have to encourage them to become our customers. Being the first dedicated sales executive, you’ll also shape the strategy and tactics that will deliver Settled’s ambitious sales & growth projections. 


 


This is an excellent opportunity for someone who wants to play a significant part in turning this innovative new company into a big player in the property world and take advantage of the huge growth potential that’s up for grabs. We train and reward enthusiastic and ambitious people in our team too.


 


Responsibilities


Your main focus in the job (80%)



  • Selling Settled’s offering to consumers buying or selling a property

  • Handling inbound and outbound leads via phone, email, and live chat.

  • Managing and optimising your pipeline.

  • Accurately recording and acting on our CRM. 

  • Smooth handover of clients to customer success managers.


 


What you also will be involved in (20%)



  • Optimising scripts, journeys and email & SMS templates. 

  • Identifying any pipeline inefficiencies and removing any bottlenecks.

  • Shaping a sales strategy for new and existing markets.

  • On success developing and growing your team (if interested). 


 


Requirements


Your experience



  • Has 1 to 5 years of sales experience preferably in real-estate or financial services.

  • Preferably bought or sold a property and/or understand the UK home-moving process well. 

  • Has the interest to work in a start-up and disrupt the property industry.

  • Has outstanding customer service skills.


 


Your personality & traits



  • Is ambitious, result-driven, proactive, energetic.

  • Is empathetic, reliable, knows how to build trust and rapport.

  • Is well-spoken and has a professional manner.

  • Is a team player.


 


Perks and benefits


Apart from the exciting opportunity, we offer the following.



  • Own a part of the business, through our employee share option scheme

  • Flexible working hours

  • Access to Perks at Work

  • Top-notch collateral, CRM systems and hardware, e.g. Apple MacBook

  • Pension Scheme

  • Company socials

  • Dog-friendly office

  • Being at the forefront of a revolution in real estate. 

  • Grow your experience in the real estate industry.


 


Culture


Settled is a dynamic company; our employees are all passionate about making a real change to the property market for the benefit of our customers.


 


We are a team of people that like to have fun both in work and out of work. Some of the things to expect from our team:



  • We love bad jokes and worse taste in music 

  • We help one another and work closely with each other 

  • And most importantly, we have fun doing so!


Drop your CV to jobs@settled.co.uk with a few words explaining why you would be suited to the role.

items.title: Director – Sales & Business Development
items.content:
Director – Sales & Business Development at Rosh Review

Remote
Your Role

You will be part of a small, remote team of thoughtful, committed individuals in a profitable company who are changing the world of medicine. You will work with medical schools, residency training programs, medical associations and physician groups to transform learning outcomes. Your customers will be highly educated in a specialized medical field such as pediatrics. You will use your consultative selling approach to listen, educate and solve customer problems while you challenge the status quo. You will strive to use your high EQ to provide customers a “wow” experience.

Must haves
  • 4 years of sales experience with proven record of success
  • Background in the health professions
  • High-degree of comfort with technology-based learning solutions
  • Exceptional verbal and written communication
  • Excellent web-based demonstration skills
  • Technological proficiency and strong working knowledge collaborative tools such as Slack, Zoom, Salesforce.com, Google Docs, Excel, and GDrive,
  • Self motivated, ability to stay on task, set and reach goals
  • A bachelor’s degree or higher
  • Thrive working with remote and distributed teams
Personal Attributes
  • Care about what is right, not who is right
  • Integrity (do the right thing even when nobody’s watching)
  • Appreciate the interconnectedness of processes and engage continuously in systems-thinking
  • Self-motivated
  • Believe we can get more done together. The sum is greater than the parts
  • Equanimity (mental calmness, even in difficult situations)
Salary and Benefits
  • Competitive salary and commissions
  • 401K with immediate vesting and company match
  • Startup hardware and software
  • Health insurance
  • Charitable donation matching
  • Work from anywhere in the USA
  • Open, honest, accessible and friendly work environment

Apply to: careers@roshreview.com
Location: US Locations Only

Apply for job

We’re looking for a new team member to join a high performing and well paid team. Your mission will be to help startup founders with our high-quality startup services. Experienced salespeople should find great services they can sell quickly.


This is a position with base and generous commission structure that has been proven to be lucrative.


This is a high earning role with existing high commission earnings and a proven service. You’ll be working with a highly successful service that we offer to our global 3.4 million founder strong network.


We prefer people that have a proven record selling B2B services, but we're open to training less experienced salespeople as well. The position can be based anywhere in the UK.


Who are you?



  • You have been successful selling to SMEs

  • You can sell over the phone, skype, in-person and/or through email

  • Smart and persuasive 

  • Great work ethic with self starter mentality

  • Strong individual performer that is able to work with an amazing team

  • Motivated by helping people

  • Fun


F6S’ global mission is to make the world a better place for tech founders and we deliver billions in value to Founders. We have an awesome UK-based team that delivers market-leading, quality services to startup founders. The team also goes on fun trips like sailing in Greece or to the beach in Brazil and benefits from awesome free lunches, a fantastic team/office environment and many other benefits.

items.title: Hireology: Account Executive, Payroll Solutions
items.content:
Account Executive, Payroll Solutions

Hireology’s technology empowers businesses to build great teams. Over the last nine years, we’ve grown from a startup to a market-leading organization with over 230 team members, and we’ve created an award-winning culture that makes this company an amazing place to work.

It’s with that in mind that Hireology is looking to add an Account Executive, Payroll Solutions to our team. This individual will work in a fast-paced collaborative environment where you will create your own activity in the field and constantly look for the next sale. We are seeking someone to bring expertise on the complexities of the payroll sales process and value proposition to new and current customers. 

Hireology is based in Chicago, but this individual can be fully-remote with the option of working from the comfort of your home or right in our office if you’re local. We’re seeking Account Executives across the nation; compensation is competitive, and we offer a full benefits package. We have regular company-wide events, semi-annual team gatherings, and frequent celebrations when we hit our goals.

As the Account Executive, Payroll Solutions, you’ll be responsible for:

  • Implement a sales strategy targeting key decision-makers and business owners to build a network and drive business 

  • Determine prospective payroll customer needs and present Hireology’s services to transform those problems into first-class solutions

  • Develop payroll partnerships with existing and potential customers to establish leads

  • Work within a national territory to close sales, win business and overachieve sales goals

  • Attend trade shows, conferences, and other events to promote Hireology’s platform 

  • You can expect to travel up to 50% to build relationships and close national payroll opportunities

So what kind of person are we looking for in this role? We have a pretty unique culture here at Hireology, and the person who will be successful in this role will be:

  • Hit the Ground Running: We need someone who knows how to navigate negotiating partnerships with large accounts and can, with little direction, effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high-growth environment.

  • Thrive in High Growth Environments: We are a rapidly growing company and, with that, comes constant change. You should be comfortable dealing with shifting priorities, demands, and timelines.  

  • Own the Result: You will be a deal captain and own your projects all the way from conception through to result.  You’ll be responsible for hitting weekly, monthly and quarterly pipeline generation and sales targets.

  • Consistently Stay Positive: Sales is exciting and challenging. We’re looking for someone with an energetic, positive, optimistic attitude.

Okay, we’ve laid out what the job is - now are you qualified? Below are the minimum qualifications we’re looking for in an Account Executive, Payroll Solutions candidate. Also, we want a chance to get to know who you are and why you applied, so please include a cover letter.

  • Pathological optimism and a can't-lose attitude, with a healthy dose of reality thrown in

  • Effective communicator with strong business acumen

  • 4+ (four) years of sales experience specifically in the Payroll vertical 

  • Demonstrated cold calling sales ability, with assertive, positive and persistent style

  • Track record of success within the payroll industry

items.title: Call Center Representative - Work From Home
items.content:
Call Center Representative Work From Home

Leverage your love of helping people, to earn money from home!

About Arise

Arise is a technology platform that connects Fortune 500 clients who need customer service support with thousands of primarily home-based call center companies run by people just like you.

A More Balanced Life and Endless Possibilities - Register to use the Arise Platform

  • You select the client programs that match your earnings expectations
  • You control your earning potential based on the frequency you work and the results you produce (and the people you hire, if you choose to do so).
  • You and you alone have the opportunity to decide what your future holds.

Be the voice of great customer service:

  • Provide customer support services from home
  • Support an impressive list of clients
  • Document issues, resolution and follow up actions
  • Learn about client products, services and customers to resolve inquiries on first contact

Interested in this opportunity?

Register today and connect with the nation s largest cable and internet provider as well as Staples, Intuit TurboTax, Carnival Cruise lines and other world-class client opportunities providing call center services and inbound sales support using the Arise Platform.

Be your own boss.
In as few as three days, and for a minimal investment, you can establish your own call center company and be registered to have access to client opportunities on the Arise Platform turning your work from home dream into a reality.


Not ready to be your own boss?

Connect with companieslooking for new agents. Before agreeing to work for a company, be clear on the details, requirements and expectations of the business. Arise does not endorse or recommend any one call center using its platform. It is your responsibility to decide whether your association with a particular call center is right for you. These companies are in no way affiliated with or controlled by Arise and Arise does not assume any legal liability or responsibility for the acts or omissions of such companies. Arise encourages you to do your due diligence and background research before you begin work for any company.


Learn more at AriseWorkFromHome.com


This is not an offer of employment. It is an opportunity to enter into a business-to-business relationship with Arise.

items.title: Remote Inbound Sales - Work At Home
items.content:
Remote Inbound Sales Work at Home

Leverage your sales skills to earn money from home.

Are you an optimistic problem solver? Do you love using your sales skills to connect people to services and products that help them in their day-to-day lives? items.title: Sr. Business Development - SaaS Sales - Remote and P/T Opportunities
items.content:
TZA is seeking a seasoned sales professional that can leverage their proven track record of success to hit the ground running and build their pipeline with our growing team.

This is an opportunity to join our expanding software team carrying 30+ years of innovation and market leadership while earning a competitive base salary, monthly bonuses and sales commissions.

Generous base salary with OTE of $85K

Sales Development Representatives (SDRs) are responsible for creating new qualified sales opportunities for the Inside Sales Team. Using CRM, email and phone, SDRs build a sales pipeline through focused prospecting and effective problem solving. Our philosophy at TZA is that a Sales Development Representative is a Sales Executive in training. If you are competitive, adaptable and thrive on having a "hunter" mentality, this role could be the opportunity for YOU!

Responsibilities

• Consistently generate 2-3 new qualified opportunities per week

• Manage and maintain a pipeline of interested prospects

• Meet and exceed daily activity targets, including cold calls and emails

• Demonstrate TZA's value proposition via high-level introductory conversations with prospects at the Senior Director, VP and CXO levels

• Engage with sales executives regarding newly generated opportunities

Requirements

• Proven track record for meeting and exceeding lead generation and sales objectives

• 1-2 years of B2B/Enterprise/SaaS experience

• Experience cold calling into private and publicly traded companies at senior levels

• Highly motivated professional with excellent written/verbal communication skills

• Experience with CRM tools (Salesforce)

Benefits

• Competitive base salary, PLUS uncapped monthly bonuses and sales commissions

• Company outings and activities (most recently TopGolf and parking lot tailgate!)

• Flexible schedule & 4.5-day work week (part-time schedules available)

• Fun sales team - monthly contests, relaxed environment, regular lunch & learns

• Culture of continuous training, teamwork and sharing best practices

• Healthcare coverage (medical/dental/vision)

• Casual dress (jeans!)

• Gym on site

• 401K w/ generous company match

• Paid vacation, sick time, and company holidays

items.title: Data Center Business Development Manager, Remote
items.content:
Job Purpose

As a Business Development Manager, you will be responsible for developing and closing new business opportunities that are sold at a price to deliver the customers' requirements without compromising our quality service within target market sectors.

Key Responsibilities

* To negotiate and successfully close sales opportunities to meet and exceed agreed sales targets within the target markets agreed by the Business Development Director and Divisional Managing Director.

* To develop and build long-term professional customer relationships with existing, new and potential clients. Maintain excellent relationships and after sales support to build mutual confidence in line with the agreed business strategy.

* To identify and build a long term active pipeline, exploring both existing markets and targeting new market opportunities

* Use innovative means to develop new sources of profitable business

* Take complete ownership of, develop and deliver exceptional sales and tender documents and presentations, in line with Company standards. Generate tenders and relevant document preparation, using the specialist support functions (procurement, HR, QHS etc) as well as local managers and the Business Development Managers.

* Raise the company and business profile by representing CBRE at industry events, high level networking and promoting an image of professionalism at all times.

* Keep up-to-date with industry developments, maintaining awareness of competitor activity and market trends.

* Ensure that the BU Leader is fully aware of all activities. Liaise regularly with the Sales Director to ensure they are fully updated on all sales activities and potential new business opportunities. Ensure that specialist functions eg HR, QHS and Commercial are advised of any new potential business to ensure compliance.

* Ensure that appropriate sign-offs are adhered to when considering new business opportunities.

* Maintain records and relevant contract documentation in the support of tenders and re-bids for the Business.

* Deal promptly and professionally with all pre-qualifications.

* Support re-bids and variations for existing clients.

Experience, Knowledge, Skills and Abilities

* Proven sales/business development experience from a relevant background

* Experience of putting together exceptional quality sales documents

* Experience of successfully delivering high level presentations

* Experience of dealing with a range of people including site staff, suppliers and customers

* Driven by targets and comfortable in a high pressure sales environment.

* Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Must be detail conscious and methodical in approach.

* Must demonstrate a strong sense of customer focus and promote a sense of team spirit within the office.

* Must be able to influence others and engender confidence in senior managers through both face-to-face, telephone and written communication.

* Self-motivated. Able to prioritise demands and make decisions under pressure. Able to work as part of a multi-disciplinary team, providing support to other areas of the business on occasions, as required.

* Be self-sufficient: able to work on your own as well as in a team.

\n\n

Bachelor's degree (BA/BS) from a 4-year college or university and a minimum of 5 years of related Sales/Business Development experience required. Having knowledge or experience with Data Center sales/operations/outsourcing is a plus and preferred. Those with IT sales backgrounds (hardware, services, or other related sales) will be considered.

* Ensure that the BU Leader is fully aware of all activities. Liaise regularly with the Sales Director to ensure they are fully updated on all sales activities and potential new business opportunities. Ensure that specialist functions eg HR, QHS and Commercial are advised of any new potential business to ensure compliance.

* Ensure that appropriate sign-offs are adhered to when considering new business opportunities.

* Maintain records and relevant contract documentation in the support of tenders and re-bids for the Business.

* Deal promptly and professionally with all pre-qualifications.

* Support re-bids and variations for existing clients.

Experience, Knowledge, Skills and Abilities

* Proven sales/business development experience from a relevant background

* Experience of putting together exceptional quality sales documents

* Experience of successfully delivering high level presentations

* Experience of dealing with a range of people including site staff, suppliers and customers

* Driven by targets and comfortable in a high pressure sales environment.

* Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Must be detail conscious and methodical in approach.

* Must demonstrate a strong sense of customer focus and promote a sense of team spirit within the office.

* Must be able to influence others and engender confidence in senior managers through both face-to-face, telephone and written communication.

* Self-motivated. Able to prioritise demands and make decisions under pressure. Able to work as part of a multi-disciplinary team, providing support to other areas of the business on occasions, as required.

* Be self-sufficient: able to work on your own as well as in a team.

\n\n

Bachelor's degree (BA/BS) from a 4-year college or university and a minimum of 5 years of related Sales/Business Development experience required. Having knowledge or experience with Data Center sales/operations/outsourcing is a plus and preferred. Those with IT sales backgrounds (hardware, services, or other related sales) will be considered.

items.content:
Hello, we’re Growth Velocity Academy


We run cutting edge digital marketing, growth hacking bootcamps for start-ups, corporates & career transitions looking to upgrade their skills and gain a competitive advantage in the market.


We’re on a mission to positively impact 1 million people in the next 5 years by helping them gain skills and confidence that help them bring their business and life to new heights…..and we need your help.


Are you that person? Do you love Selling?

Application Deadline: 15th November, 11.59 pm GMT


Apply here: https://growth-velocity-academy.breezy.hr/p/7cb82b0f7bd9-international-sales-manager


What we’re looking for:



  • We’re looking for a dependable and enthusiastic Sales Manager that takes initiative to work as a key part of the Growth Velocity team

  • First and foremost, you must care about what we do – helping people gain in demand skills to secure jobs they love

  • You Inspire everyone you talk with

  • You are extremely comfortable speaking with marketers and entrepreneurs – doing sales calls every day, delivering value and ensuring prospects are a fit

  • You know results mean everything and you’ll be measured by your results vs target

  • You are able to build relationships and understand the metrics around your sale

  • You have excellent communication, organizational, and analytical skills

  • You love developing educational material, including presentations, sales scripts and case studies to be included in the company operations manual

  • You are experienced with online tools (ie: Google docs, sheets, Trello, Zoom, Calendly, ActiveCampaign)

  • You have a passion for software and technology


Job Brief: We are looking for a Sales Manager that will take ownership of closing various leads that are looking to sign up to one of our One Week Intensive Digital Marketing Bootcamps taking place in our designated cities.


Responsibilities:



  • Hitting sales targets and maintaining profit margins

  • Researching and onboarding potential partnerships with key partners in designated cities

  • Leading on the sales conversations for your cities

  • Marketing for each of the events (including but not limited to):

  • Reaching out to new and existing contacts and partners

  • Personal Network (if applicable)


Locations / Culture



  • This is a fully remote role. You will need a reliable fast internet connection (essential), the rest…we’ll show you how it works.

  • Ability to work full-time Mon - Fri, Timezone: GMT +2

  • We have a strong culture (despite being virtual) centred around excellence, accountability and data-driven decisions…if accountability and excellence put you off now, please save us both the time and give this role a miss.


What’s in it for you



  • Your chance to join one of the world’s fastest-growing tech academies

  • Access to some of the world’s cutting-edge marketing and sales training

  • Company retreats (our last one was in Turkey this summer)

  • Remote work from anywhere in the world


Nice to have:



  • Able to speak Arabic

items.title: Sales Director
items.content:
Sales Director at Xtensio

Remote

(Full-time, Remote)

We are looking for someone who will contribute heavily to the evolution of our brand.

OVERVIEW

We are an organically growing platform with over 200K users. We get 15,000+ signups each month. We are looking for a sales expert who will qualify our (free and paid) users and turn them into paying customers. You will be responsible for the whole sales cycle from prospecting internally to closing the deal.

RESPONSIBILITIES

You will support marketing, biz-dev, product and content efforts.

  • Qualify inbound leads (15K+ signups each month) and develop relationships
  • Generate sales conversations through email campaigns (drip campaigns, in-app messages as well as outreach via external networks)
  • Coordinate product demonstrations between the customer success team and prospective customers.
  • Track communication and engagement (attention to detail is a must)
  • Close sales and assist customers with onboarding

Over time, you’ll build a sales team & repeatable processes/practices to scale. You’ll contribute heavily to the evolution of our brand. And overall, you’ll play a critical role in Xtensio’s growth.

ABOUT YOU

  • You have a BA in Marketing, Communications or Business and come with at least 1 year of B2B sales experience.
  • You are growth-minded and looking to turn challenges into opportunities
  • You have a proven track record of building ongoing relationship with customers.
  • You are familiar with working remotely and using project management and communication tools like Trello, Slack and Xtensio.
  • You are an existing Xtensio user. You have used the templates, created folios and worked with the product before.
  • You are very familiar with SaaS products used by startup teams, marketing professionals.
  • You have pristine one-on-one communication skills with courtesy and professionalism.
  • You are extremely detail oriented, have an excellent memory and can multi-task to operate on complex communication flows.
  • You have user experience sensibilities and understand that your role is tightly interconnected with product and content teams’ efforts.
Apply for job

items.title: Sales Development Representative
items.content:
Sales Development Representative at Assemble

Remote | Entry-level | Freelance | Part-time
Sales Development Representative:

Assemble is a project management platform for creatives, enabling producers, directors, photographers and more to collaborate and create content. We’re a fast growing company united by our passion for building incredible products for the creative industry.

Assemble is based in Los Angeles, CA, but our team is fully distributed and spans three continents. We’ve worked with clients such as Amazon, Asics and Tonka to help them streamline their content production workflow.

As Sales Development Representative you will be responsible for connecting with potential new customers and ensuring that they get activated and introduced to our sales team. From taking on new challenges, to working with a fast growing technology company, we promise you will grow, learn and make a difference.

If you’re a person who is driven by delivering results for customers and thrives in a fast paced environment, then this is the perfect position for you.

You’re Good At:
  • Strong and clear written and verbal communication
  • Strong empathy for customers and their success
  • Desire for committing, over-delivering and following up with customers to help them be more successful
  • Managing your work and collaboration in a highly organized and proactive fashion
  • Communicating brand and products effectively and clearly to potential customers
Bonus Points:
  • You love inspiring others with enthusiasm
  • You love connecting with people
What You’ll Do:

As Sales Development Representative, you’ll be responsible for:

  • Managing outreach to new prospects to educate them about our product
  • Ensuring follow up and rapid response to questions
  • Outbound phone calls to qualify leads and schedule product demos with our sales team
  • Qualifying prospects and identifying qualified sales leads for the sales team
  • Meet monthly Qualified Leads Quota.
  • Manage our CRM and ensure exceptional data upkeep
  • Schedule follow ups after demos to nurture opportunities
What You’ll Need:
  • 2+ years of experience in environments with preference for sales development and customer success
  • Experience with a CRM
  • History of meeting exceeding customer expectations
  • Excellent communication, organizational and analytical skills
  • Extremely comfortable engaging with customers to educate them about our product
Why Join Us:

Working at Assemble can accelerate your career and give you the opportunity to work in a unique blend of the technology and creative industries. Be in control of your own schedule and work towards team objectives to help us build the creative platform of the future.

Location: USA or Canada

Apply for job

items.content:
ABOUT US


City Relay is a rapidly growing short rent property management company based in London venturing also in property acquisition, development and management. 


This is a unique opportunity to join a fast-growing start-up. The position requires a highly motivated, bright and committed individual who thrives in a dynamic and challenging environment and is result-driven. You’ll be supporting our Business Development Team with the onboarding of new clients and related administration tasks.


DUTIES 



  • Work closely with the Business Development team

  • Deal with introductory calls with potential clients: present our offers to potential clients by giving them all relevant information, promoting our competitive advantage and be ready to respond to any questions.

  • Responsible for the onboarding of clients e.g. scheduling photo shoots, initial clean, listings, EPCs

  • Communicating with the Reservations and Distribution Team for property listing

  • Using our CRM - Pipedriver efficiently to support the admin needs of the department

  • Aid in the preparation of monthly sales reports


REQUIREMENTS



  • Great communicator with excellent written English is mandatory                        

  • Studying towards a Business, Management, Sales or another relevant degree

  • Negotiation skills

  • Attention to detail

  • Organisation and coordination skills


BENEFITS 



  • £500 per month + £200 monthly discretionary bonus

  • Exciting work experience in a fast-paced environment and opportunities of self-development

  • Fun social team nights

  • Learning as much for the industry and working with a young, multinational and dynamic team

  • Cool office located in Portobello market

items.title: Cloudcraft: Sales Development Representative
items.content:
Sales Development Representative

Cloudcraft, Inc.

Cloudcraft is the leading architecture visualization service for AWS developers, solution architects, and engineers around the world. We support more than 200,000 users helping development teams design, optimize and collaborate with Live blueprints of their AWS cloud environment in real-time.

Launched in 2016 we are a small and growing team that is bootstrapped and profitable. The Cloudcraft platform has had initial success completely through word-of-mouth adoption. To support our rapidly growing user base we are scaling our Sales, Marketing, and Customer Success teams.


If you want to have an impact, you are entrepreneurial, and you enjoy working remotely consider joining our 100% remote team today!


Sales Development Representative

Cloudcraft is seeking a full-time Sales Development Representative to join our 100% remote Sales team. The ideal candidate will be a self-starter with a proven track record of success, with 1+ years of work experience in a technical B2B SaaS Sales environment. This is a great opportunity for the right candidate to join a small and fast-growing company and have a big impact on our Sales organization and company growth.


What you’ll do:
  • Spearhead the growth & adoption of Cloudcraft with Enterprise customers
  • Maintain active engagement with new and existing leads through various inbound sales channels to increase customer knowledge and interest in the Cloudcraft visualization platform.
  • Respond to and qualify incoming prospects regarding interest in Cloudcraft
  • Schedule Cloudcraft hands-on demos and follow-up training sessions with Account Executives and Cloudcraft Customer Support.
  • Promote Cloudcraft to incoming prospects and customers by adding value during every customer touchpoint
  • Partner with our experienced AE's to help fill our pipeline with qualified leads while growing your product knowledge and sales skills
  • Learn, create, and share best practices, wins, failures, and new ideas with the Sales organization. We meet once a week to discuss what’s working and what isn’t so we can continually improve our sales process.
  • Achieve monthly, quarterly and annual quotas for qualified leads and net new business
Requirements

You’re a great fit if …
  • You have 1+ year(s) of work experience in technical B2B SaaS sales
  • You have consistently been a top performer in prior roles
  • You have experience working with technical products, Amazon Web Services, or possess the aptitude and willingness to quickly learn about AWS and other cloud service providers
  • You are a self starter and have a bias for action
  • You are hungry to contribute knowledge and improve our sales process
Is this you?
  • Self-starter with a track record of successful lead follow-up and sales development experience with technical teams, developers, solution architects, VP, and C-level prospects
  • Eager to help prospective teams and users be successful with our platform through hands-on training, presentations, and demos acting as a trusted advisor
  • Pre-call planning and research, setting agendas and managing nexts steps in the sales process
  • Opportunity qualification and objection handling
  • Successfully manage discovery and demo calls with remote screen-sharing (Zoom, Hangouts, Webex)
  • Time management. We are serious about work-life balance.
  • Consistent track record achieving measurable inside sales goals in an automated sales environment. Accurate and precise management of leads, opportunities, and tasks in a CRM system.
  • You can work with our internal teams to answer questions, receive feedback, and learn about the product to continuously improve your customer interactions
  • Positive and energetic video call/screen-share skills, excellent listening skills, strong written and oral communication skills
  • Proficient with standard our internal productivity tools (GSuite, CRM, email automation, LinkedIn)
  • Have completed or working on AWS certifications: Cloud Practitioner, Solution Architect, et. al.; excited to learn more about all things cloud (AWS, Azure, GCP) and achieve technical certifications
Benefits
  • Competitive salary with uncapped commission
  • Medical/Dental/Vision benefits
  • HSA & FSA benefit accounts
  • Paid Time Off
  • Pre-tax Commuter benefits
  • Company sponsored continuous education and industry certifications

items.title: Cloudcraft: Account Executive
items.content:
Account Executive

Cloudcraft, Inc.

Cloudcraft is the leading architecture visualization service for AWS developers, solution architects, and engineers around the world. We support more than 200,000 users helping development teams design, optimize and collaborate with Live blueprints of their AWS cloud environment in real-time.

Launched in 2016 we are a small and growing team that is bootstrapped and profitable. The Cloudcraft platform has had initial success completely through word-of-mouth adoption. To support our rapidly growing user base we are scaling our Sales, Marketing, and Customer Success teams.

If you want to have an impact, you are entrepreneurial, and you enjoy working remotely consider joining our 100% remote team today!


Account Executive

We are hiring an experienced Account Executive to join our growing B2B Inside Sales department. As a Cloudcraft Account Executive you are the initial point of contact and hands-on product expert tasked with ensuring customer satisfaction. Cloudcraft is a technical product and your day-to-day sales activities require hands-on expertise. You will have the opportunity to engage in continuous learning about all things cloud (AWS, Azure, GCP).

As an Account Executive, you will demonstrate product functionality, understand customer use-cases and requirements, and support users as they integrate Cloudcraft into their Cloud/AWS workflow. You will act proactively to address customer needs and facilitate the sales process from initial contact through deal completion and opportunity widening.


Responsibilities
  • Perform remote screen-share demos of Cloudcraft for prospects
  • Manage sales email campaigns for a continuous pipeline of inbound leads
  • Manage and support the decision making process of companies evaluating Cloudcraft
  • Act as the main point of contact for prospects from initial contact to a Won opportunity
  • Organize follow-up customer meetings to deep dive and satisfy user requirements
  • Effectively communicate Cloudcraft business value and demonstrate use-cases for users unfamiliar with the platform
  • Communicate security and privacy best practices. Customer data security is paramount; our #1 priority.
  • Troubleshoot issues and objection handling in a timely manner
  • Identify and qualify new potential customers, manage your time, learn from mistakes, and sharpen your ability to identify a good product fit.
  • Coordinate with Sales Development Representatives and Marketing team to ensure our messaging and goals are aligned
  • Stay up-to-date with new product features and product launches
  • Establish sales and Cloudcraft best practices, communicate successes and failures with the Cloudcraft team so we may continuously improve our internal process
  • Monitor and report on sales performance metrics
  • Suggest ideas and gather customer requirements to increase sales and improve the customer experience
  • Meet or exceed your monthly, quarterly, and annual sales quota

Requirements
  • Reliable Internet access for remote working
  • Past work experience as a SaaS B2B Account Executive
  • Hands-on experience in a customer facing role requiring live product demos
  • An ability to gasp clients needs and to increase customer engagement
  • Past work experience with CRM software, email/marketing automation
  • Ability to learn and demonstrate Cloudcraft capabilities to prospective and current customers.
  • Ability to work remotely with our company tool-set (Slack, email, SaaS services)
  • Experience scheduling, managing, and leading remote screen-share discovery and demo calls
  • Learn, understand, meet and exceed sales performance goals
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills
  • Negotiation skills, objection handling
  • Past work experience with technical SaaS products
  • Due to our work with government agencies and partners: US Persons / Citizenship required

You’ll be a great fit at Cloudcraft if:
  • You have past work experience with Amazon Web Services
  • You have designed, managed, or deployed applications/solutions on AWS
  • You are eager to continuously learn about AWS and cloud service providers like Microsoft Azure and Google Cloud Platform
  • You are excited to have a major impact on Cloudcraft's growth
  • You have received or are currently working towards an AWS Certification (Cloud Practitioner, Solution Architect, etc.)

Benefits

  • Competitive salary with uncapped commission
  • Medical/Dental/Vision benefits
  • HSA & FSA benefit accounts
  • Paid Time Off
  • Pre-tax Commuter benefits
  • Company sponsored continuous education and industry certifications

items.title: Data Center Business Development Manager, Remote
items.content:
Job Purpose

As a Business Development Manager, you will be responsible for developing and closing new business opportunities that are sold at a price to deliver the customers' requirements without compromising our quality service within target market sectors.

Key Responsibilities

* To negotiate and successfully close sales opportunities to meet and exceed agreed sales targets within the target markets agreed by the Business Development Director and Divisional Managing Director.

* To develop and build long-term professional customer relationships with existing, new and potential clients. Maintain excellent relationships and after sales support to build mutual confidence in line with the agreed business strategy.

* To identify and build a long term active pipeline, exploring both existing markets and targeting new market opportunities

* Use innovative means to develop new sources of profitable business

* Take complete ownership of, develop and deliver exceptional sales and tender documents and presentations, in line with Company standards. Generate tenders and relevant document preparation, using the specialist support functions (procurement, HR, QHS etc) as well as local managers and the Business Development Managers.

* Raise the company and business profile by representing CBRE at industry events, high level networking and promoting an image of professionalism at all times.

* Keep up-to-date with industry developments, maintaining awareness of competitor activity and market trends.

* Ensure that the BU Leader is fully aware of all activities. Liaise regularly with the Sales Director to ensure they are fully updated on all sales activities and potential new business opportunities. Ensure that specialist functions eg HR, QHS and Commercial are advised of any new potential business to ensure compliance.

* Ensure that appropriate sign-offs are adhered to when considering new business opportunities.

* Maintain records and relevant contract documentation in the support of tenders and re-bids for the Business.

* Deal promptly and professionally with all pre-qualifications.

* Support re-bids and variations for existing clients.

Experience, Knowledge, Skills and Abilities

* Proven sales/business development experience from a relevant background

* Experience of putting together exceptional quality sales documents

* Experience of successfully delivering high level presentations

* Experience of dealing with a range of people including site staff, suppliers and customers

* Driven by targets and comfortable in a high pressure sales environment.

* Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Must be detail conscious and methodical in approach.

* Must demonstrate a strong sense of customer focus and promote a sense of team spirit within the office.

* Must be able to influence others and engender confidence in senior managers through both face-to-face, telephone and written communication.

* Self-motivated. Able to prioritise demands and make decisions under pressure. Able to work as part of a multi-disciplinary team, providing support to other areas of the business on occasions, as required.

Be self-sufficient: able to work on your own as well as in a team

\n\n

Bachelor's degree (BA/BS) from a 4-year college or university and a minimum of 5 years of related Sales/Business Development experience required. Having knowledge or experience with Data Center sales/operations/outsourcing is a plus and preferred. Those with IT sales backgrounds (hardware, services, or other related sales) will be considered.

* Ensure that the BU Leader is fully aware of all activities. Liaise regularly with the Sales Director to ensure they are fully updated on all sales activities and potential new business opportunities. Ensure that specialist functions eg HR, QHS and Commercial are advised of any new potential business to ensure compliance.

* Ensure that appropriate sign-offs are adhered to when considering new business opportunities.

* Maintain records and relevant contract documentation in the support of tenders and re-bids for the Business.

* Deal promptly and professionally with all pre-qualifications.

* Support re-bids and variations for existing clients.

Experience, Knowledge, Skills and Abilities

* Proven sales/business development experience from a relevant background

* Experience of putting together exceptional quality sales documents

* Experience of successfully delivering high level presentations

* Experience of dealing with a range of people including site staff, suppliers and customers

* Driven by targets and comfortable in a high pressure sales environment.

* Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Must be detail conscious and methodical in approach.

* Must demonstrate a strong sense of customer focus and promote a sense of team spirit within the office.

* Must be able to influence others and engender confidence in senior managers through both face-to-face, telephone and written communication.

* Self-motivated. Able to prioritise demands and make decisions under pressure. Able to work as part of a multi-disciplinary team, providing support to other areas of the business on occasions, as required.

* Be self-sufficient: able to work on your own as well as in a team.

\n\n

Bachelor's degree (BA/BS) from a 4-year college or university and a minimum of 5 years of related Sales/Business Development experience required. Having knowledge or experience with Data Center sales/operations/outsourcing is a plus and preferred. Those with IT sales backgrounds (hardware, services, or other related sales) will be considered.

items.title: Data Center Business Development Manager, Remote

Generate tenders and relevant document preparation, using the specialist support functions (procurement, HR, QHS etc) as well as local managers and the Business Development Managers.

items.title: Head of Business Development and Partnerships
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, anywher, base, resid) 7W OR(europ, european, europeanunion)
items.content:
Head of Business Development and Partnerships at Microverse

Remote | High-paying | International

$40k – $100k

With full-time students in 80+ countries and funding from Y Combinator and other top-tier funds from Silicon Valley, Microverse is looking for a Head of Business Development to build relationships with employers worldwide, helping us connect the world’s most talented individual with international opportunities. We have hundreds, and soon thousands of students, and your job is to give them jobs.

The right candidate will have strategic and hands-on experience defining, implementing and growing large-scale programs for global companies. This includes demonstrated business development and selling experience, and experience in developing programmatic approaches to build and scale programs, strong program and project management skills, a customer-obsessed and collaborative approach, strong data and metrics bias, a good understanding of the remote software development job market, and a passion for helping people transform their lives through education and training.

Responsibilities

  • Establishing long-term partnerships with software engineering employers worldwide, both with remote-only and remote-first companies, as well as with local companies in our main markets.
  • Managing relationships with employers to understand their hiring needs, develop personalized training programs, understand their selection process, collect feedback about our graduates, implement mentorship initiatives, create internship opportunities, and facilitate the participation of their team members in our community through webinars, mock interviews, and other events.
  • Working with the Career Services team and its career coaches, as well as with the Curriculum & Learning team of Microverse to align student outcomes with the needs of our hiring partners.
  • Managing our Launchpad program to help companies manage international payments and compliance when hiring our students worldwide.
  • Identifying new strategic verticals and markets to expand our value proposition and focus our growth efforts.
  • Managing and growing a world-class business development team to meet the expectations of our graduating students and growth objectives.
  • Establish partnerships with other organizations such as content providers, job listing companies, governments, and international payment providers.

Requirements

  • 5+ years of demonstrated success in a business development or partnerships role working with customers and partners from all cultures and backgrounds
  • Experience in the placement and recruiting market with a deep understanding of how remote companies hire and operate
  • Experience working at a fast-growing company and leading world-class partnerships and programs
  • Highly analytical, strategic and creative thinker with strong business judgment
  • Ability to drive initiatives with minimal structure, and be influential within the Microverse team to garner internal support for your initiatives
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills to build relationships, manage a team, influence stakeholders, and inspire others
  • Willingness to get your hands dirty, lead by example, and motivate teams
  • Passion for Microverse’s mission and its role in improving people’s lives through education
  • Experience using tools and technology to make your work more efficient

You ideally…

  • Have a deep understanding of how technical recruiting works and what companies look for when hiring software engineers and other IT professionals
  • Have prior startup and remote experience working for a global company
  • Have high empathy for working with individuals from different countries and cultures
  • Are based in Europe/Americas/Africa (for maximum timezone overlap)
  • Consider yourself to be a global citizen and passionate about making opportunity more equally distributed around the world

What we offer

  • Help change the lives of thousands of people from all around the world by helping them start international careers
  • Join and shape the direction of a rapidly growing startup backed by some of the top funds in Silicon Valley
  • Become part of a company that is leading the way people collaborate and work remotely, both internally and through the training of our students and partners
  • Join the team at company retreats all around the world every year and enjoy our travel allowance to meet with team members anywhere in the world
  • Work alongside a fully distributed team that lives all around the world and believe in our core values:

We are global citizens
We are passionate about our mission
We invest in people
We are eager learners
We are transparent
We take ownership of our work
We live a harmonious life

The position is a full-time remote position.

Microverse is an equal opportunity employer and acts in this capacity without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, or disability.

NOTE: Our company has competitive and transparent salaries adjusted for cost-of-living in different geographies. Your salary will depend on experience as well as the average cost of living in your area using a custom-made salary calculator for remote-employees.

Hires remotely in: Europe,North America,South America,Africa,Central America

Visa sponsorship: Not available

Experience: 5+ years

Apply for job

items.content:
Event Ticketing and Sales at Working Solutions

Remote | Freelance

Job Locations: US-Remote – Work from Home – US

Category: Customer Service/Support

Overview

This is a remote, independent contractor role. Contractors will take inbound customer service calls and will talk to buyers and sellers to answer questions to ensure that every customer interaction provides a great entertainment experience. Contractors will provide first call resolution or determine the appropriate triage route. Need to have some working knowledge and interest in sports, music or theatre. Must be fast thinkers with excellent communication skills who can clearly answer questions and anticipate future needs.

Responsibilities

  • Practicing excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  • Providing top-notch customer service skills while guiding callers to the right solutions for their specific needs.
  • Having a positive attitude; being flexible and adaptable to change.
  • Researching, navigating and independently locating answers from webpages and resources in a variety of situations.
  • Communicating effectively, based on a customer’s mindset.
  • Exercising strong, multitasking skills while navigating through multiple websites and making themselves available for incoming calls.
  • Demonstrating a sincere desire to assist customers and put their needs first.

Qualifications

Education and Experience:

  • At least 1 to 2 years of experience in a high-volume, customer-service role (i.e. call center, retail or similar environment).
  • Having achieved a satisfactory level of technical skill or knowledge. Familiarity with operating systems, including Windows OS versions and/or Mac OS versions. Ability to install and uninstall applications. Ability to download products and applications using various browsers.

Competencies:

  • Technical Skills: Proficient data-entry skills. Ability to achieve a “meets expectations” rating or higher on scorecard.
  • Problem-solving/Analysis: Ability to solve problems through systematic analysis of processes with sound judgment. Have a realistic understanding of relevant issues.
  • Organizational Skills: Ability to organize people or tasks, adjust to priorities and learn systems— within time constraints, and with available resources. Must be detail-oriented.
  • Multi-tasking/Time Management: Prioritize and manage actions to meet changing deadlines and requirements within a high volume.
  • Information Management: Ability to manage large amounts of complex information easily, communicate clearly and draw sound conclusions.
  • Independent Thinking/Self-initiative: Critical thinker with ability to focus on things that matter most to achieve outcomes. Commitment to produce outcomes without direction and capable of finding necessary resources.
  • Empathy/Customer Service: Customer-focused behavior, exhibiting a helping approach that includes listening, patience, respect and empathy for another’s position.
  • Coping/Flexibility: Resiliency in adapting to a variety of situations and individuals while maintaining a sense of purpose and mature problem-solving approach are required.
  • Computer Literacy: Ability to function in a multisystem Microsoft environment—using Word, Outlook, intranet, the internet and software applications.
  • Communication/People Skills: Ability to influence or persuade others under positive or negative circumstances. Adapt to different styles, listen critically and collaborate.
  • Commitment to Task: Ability to conform to established policies and procedures. Exhibit high motivation.
  • Quality Orientation: Accomplishes tasks by considering all areas involved, no matter how small. Shows concern for all aspects of the job. Motivated toward constantly improving. Sets high standards for self-performance. Takes responsibility and accountability for successfully completing assignments or tasks.

Independent contractors on this program will need to successfully pass a background check to work. This check will consist of a Social Security number verification, National Sex Offender Registry report and a criminal history check.

We are currently not accepting independent contractors residing in California, New York, Pennsylvania or Washington.

Apply for job

items.content:
We are Hex

We’re a new breed of smaller, leaner agencies. A team in the truest sense of the word. Our strength lies in our ability to bring together deep digital expertise in a team of marketers, digital experts, thinkers, and doers. Working harmoniously to deliver well-rounded creativity, free from the corporate shackles that lead to uninspired work full of me too’s and me three’s.

We have an insatiable curiosity for the world around us, with skills and interests that go far beyond our job descriptions. It makes us a team of hybrids, able to bring fresh perspectives to every project.

We believe great work happens when creative minds feel comfortable to be themselves.

Digital Account Manager

Hex thrives on excellent, enduring client relationships. Our clients consider us passionate about their business, partners in their efforts and jointly responsible for their success.

We're looking for a smart, friendly, creative and unflappable Digital Account Manager to nurture existing relationships and grow new opportunities. You'll be the go-to person for the client, ensuring best-in-class strategy, execution and reporting across the board.

Day-to-day you'll:

  • Expertly balance the demands of multiple clients, accounts and integrated digital strategies
  • Develop new strategies to increase clients' competitive advantage
  • Broaden clients' understanding of their customers, markets and challenges
  • Produce valuable status reports and meeting agendas
  • Strive for product excellence with an incredible eye for detail
  • Support the delivery team to ensure timely, top-quality delivery
  • Support the wider client services team with research, analysis and insight
  • Produce compelling, insightful reports
  • Work on new business pitches
  • Manage contracts

What we'd like to see in you:

  • Proven 360° digital experience
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Mastery of client interpretation
  • Motivation generator with great work ethic
  • Level 10 pitching/deck skills
  • Passion for digital platforms + technologies

Benefits:

  • We're based in the beating heart of Farringdon surrounded with markets, cafes and great places to eat
  • Bonus scheme dependent on your role
  • Hex lunches
  • Monthly socials & away days
  • Company MacBook Pro
  • Flexible working hours when required
  • Access to ongoing off-site training/conferences
  • Oh, and 25 days holiday should you need a break at any point

items.content:
About Applied


Hiring (and being hired) is one of the most important things we do, but humans are frankly terrible at it. We look for the wrong things, we’re biased, and we don’t follow the data.


Applied is a tech start-up that uses cutting edge behavioural science, data and research to enable organisations to hire the best person for the job, regardless of race, gender or background.


By helping hiring managers focus on what matters, and removing unconscious bias, we’ve helped hundreds of teams in retail, consulting, finance, tech, media, charity and government hire over 3,000 diverse, high performing candidates across 5 continents. The benefits our customers are realising are astounding – everything from a 66% reduction in time spent on recruitment to a 3x improvement in attracting more diverse candidates.


People need to feel the value of the product and this is where you come in! We’re looking for a Sales Development Representative to work within our growing commercial team, helping Applied to scale and connect with even more forward-thinking organisations.


This is your chance to get in on the ground floor of a fast growing, investor-backed start-up and be part of changing the way hiring is done on a global scale. You can read more about us in the New York Times, Harvard Business Review, TechCrunch and New Scientist.


A bit about you and the role


We believe that diverse and inclusive teams both perform better and make for a richer work life. As such we’re open to all candidates, irrespective of where they’ve derived their skills and passion for this role from.


More specifically, we’re looking for somebody that is:




  • Empowered by an entrepreneurial environment - you’re a self-starter, can work autonomously but can motivate and influence other teams when required.




  • Positive, resilient and determined – you’re able to pick yourself up after a setback, work out what went wrong and have another go.




  • Passionate for improving workplaces - whether it’s diversity & inclusion or culture, you’ll love what you do and want a world where everyone is free to be their true selves in a job they love.




  • Loves learning and thrives on feedback - in a start-up, none of us have all the answers, so an openness and willingness to constantly learn is essential.




  • Driven and proactive - following up with leads to keep the momentum of conversations going, and not letting things slip through the net.




Your skills & areas of focus


This role will give you the opportunity to interact with leads at the early stages of the sales process - from initial research and outreach to qualifying inbound leads and doing discovery calls.


Here’s a taste of what you’ll be involved in on a day-to-day basis:




  • Researching and reaching out to potential new clients in creative and scalable ways.




  • Nurturing outbound leads’ responses and queries, with the aim of converting them into conversations with our Growth & Partnerships Managers




  • Qualifying inbound leads based on whether their company is a good fit for one of Applied’s several solutions.




  • Communicating in an effective and engaging manner to not only understand the potential customer’s needs better, but also to help identify which solution in our product portfolio fits their needs best.




  • Assisting with the management and administration of the CRM.




  • Assisting with the analysis of sales performance metrics (in Excel / Google Sheets etc.).




  • Assisting with the curation of the sales resources we share with potential new customers.




  • Working closely with the Sales, Marketing & Product teams to feed back on market insights for the refinement of marketing messages and the enhancement of product features.




Like the rest of the Applied team members you'll benefit from:




  • Equity in the business




  • Employee benefits package




  • Flexible / partially remote working options




  • Involved in other aspects of the business, from strategy, management and training, to shaping team culture
