tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=1}
items.content:
Who We Are

Administrate is a training management platform used by hundreds of companies around the world to plan, design, deliver, and measure learning and development for their employees and customers. Our mission is to provide an industry-leading platform that enables enterprises to run their training function more efficiently and effectively so that they can focus more on connecting with people than administrating programs.


We are a fast growing, energetic company, with an established global customer base, a solid core team, and a clear vision. And, we’re looking for a new addition to our sales team!

 

We are a quickly growing, energetic company, with an established global customer base, a solid core team, and a clear vision.  Oh yeah, we also work a 4 day, 32 hour week, but we’ll pay you a 5 day wage.

Where We Are

We are headquartered in the city centre of Edinburgh, the capital of Scotland. We also have offices in Beirut, Lebanon and Bozeman, USA. This job will be located at our Bozeman office.

 

About You

You love a challenge. You want to be the best. You aren’t afraid to find new ways to get past a barrier to get to your goal. Energy is a choice for you and your energy is contagious for every person you interact with throughout the day. You want more out of life and are willing to roll up your sleeves and work hard for it. You take pride and ownership in everything you do.


You’re a great communicator, and create relationships quickly. People want to work with you. At work, you adhere to high standards, take input, provide input, and wrestle with problems until they're solved cleanly.  You enjoy working on a creative team in a collaborative fashion.


You love to work with smart, creative people and despise mediocrity. Small teams, dynamic organisations, and flexible working environments are what you thrive in. Bureaucracy is for someone else who likes wasting time and effort.


Your work day goes by quickly and you leave at the end of the day with a smile on your face.


What You'll Do

Administrate is seeking candidates looking to advance their careers by joining our rapidly growing sales team as a Business Development Representative. We are committed to investing in your future by training you in marketing, sales, and professional skills that will serve you at Administrate and beyond.

 

You will have an open mind and are willing to learn our systems quickly. You will take advantage of our career development track and own your career progression within Administrate. Opportunities abound.

 

You will work with marketing to provide sales with qualified, pre-screened leads that are ready to engage in the buying process.  You will need to quickly develop a deep understanding of our product, our market, our ideal customer profile.

 

Responsibilities


  • Establishing relationships with corporate executives and influencers via cold call, email and social strategies

  • Drive sales growth and pipeline through setting up qualified meetings for Account Executives

  • Maintain and organize an annual book of business

  • Be a subject matter expert and evangelist of Administrate’s platform.  Qualify prospects based on their needs/problems against a fit with our offering.

  • Produce creative strategies for targeting decision-makers at prospect accounts in order to book sales appointments and influence company revenue

  • Strong understanding of CRM in order to input



Requirements


  • Bachelor’s degree in Business, Communication or a related field

  • 1-2 years of experience in a quota carrying position

  • Experience with outreach such as cold calling and emailing

  • Exceptional written and verbal communication skills

  • Strong time management and organization skills

  • Previous experience using marketing automation software is preferred


 

What You'll Get


  • Enjoy working as part of a talented team where everyone’s input is valued

  • An unrivalled work/life balance – you work a 4-day, 32-hour, week but get paid for 5 days!

  • 22 days paid vacation per year (includes standard US holidays if you choose to take these off)

  • Great tools – MacBook, 27” monitor, mechanical keyboard etc

  • Flexible working schedule

  • Pizza Wednesdays

  • Beer fridge, free snacks and great coffee

  • Corporate membership option at The Ridge

  • Healthcare, Vision & Dental, FSA

  • 401k retirement plan with company match

  • Life and Accidental Death and Dismemberment Insurance

items.content:
Who we are

Administrate is an online training platform that helps training providers save time and money. Our mission is to make our customer’s training operations and training courses run better for less money.


We are a quickly growing, young, energetic company, with an established global customer base, a solid core team, and a clear vision. Oh yeah, and we work 4 day weeks.

 

Where We Are

We are headquartered in the city centre of Edinburgh, the capital of Scotland. We also have offices in Beirut, Lebanon and Bozeman, USA. This job will be located at our Bozeman office.


About You
You love a challenge. You want to be the best. You aren’t afraid to find new ways to get past a barrier to get to your goal. Energy is a choice for you and your energy is contagious for every person you interact with throughout the day. You want more out of life and are willing to roll up your sleeves and work hard for it. You take pride and ownership in everything you do.


You’re a great communicator, and create relationships quickly. People want to work with you. You’re able to confidently present and influence credibly and effectively at all levels of an organization, and have a proven ability to drive an enterprise sales process from plan to close.


At work, you adhere to high standards, take input, provide input, and love solving problems. You are an autonomous professional and anticipate needs and next steps. You enjoy working on a very creative team in a collaborative fashion to drive results.

You are a high performer with high potential and will need to own and drive your development plan

 

You love to work with smart, creative people and hate mediocrity. Small teams, dynamic organizations, and flexible working environments are what you thrive in. Bureaucracy is for someone else who likes wasting time and effort.


Your workday goes by quickly and you leave at the end of the day with a smile on your face.


You have a strong business acumen, ability to drive conversations with enterprise c-suites, and ideally at least 4-5 years previous experience as a B2B Software as a Service (SaaS) Enterprise Account Executive.


What You’ll Do

We are looking for a high-performing Account Executive to help us meet our customer acquisition and revenue growth targets in North America. 


You will work hard to achieve sales targets. You will project manage your sales by collaborating with multiple internal and external stakeholders to discover more about the needs of our prospects, regularly present via Zoom and in person meetings and follow the sales process through to a win. You will speak at events and take any opportunity to promote our brand. You are the face of our brand in the marketplace and the driver of our key sales relationships.


You will have an open mind and are willing to learn our systems quickly. You will take advantage of our career development track and own your career progression within Administrate. Opportunities abound.


You’ll be required to quickly develop a deep understanding of our product, our market and our ideal customer profile.


Responsibilities


  • Achieve growth and revenue targets consistently

  • Contribute to implementing our strategic plan that expands the company’s customer base and ensures a strong foothold in the North American market

  • Build and promote strong, long-lasting customer relationships with Administrate by partnering with them in the sale to deliver the right solution

  • Work with the team to present sales, revenue reports and realistic forecasts to the management team

  • Identify emerging market opportunities and market shifts while maintaining a good understanding of the competitive landscape



What You'll Get


  • Enjoy working as part of a talented team where everyone’s input is valued

  • An unrivalled work/life balance – you work a 4 day, 32 hour, week but get paid for 5 days!

  • 22 days paid vacation per year (includes standard US holidays if you choose to take these off)

  • Great tools – new MacBook, 27” monitor, mechanical keyboard etc

  • Flexible working schedule

  • Pizza Wednesdays

  • Beer fridge, free snacks and great coffee

  • Corporate membership at The Ridge

  • Healthcare, Vision & Dental, FSA

  • 401k retirement plan with company match

  • Life and Accidental Death and Dismemberment Insurance

items.content:
About us


At WeGift, we’re enabling value to go further, move faster and be used more freely. We’re completely reinventing the digital branded currency category, and creating a world where everyone has access to the global economy with no banks, borders or boundaries. To date we have built the industry’s premier digital rewards platform and are already working with the world’s leading brands like Amazon, Nike and Uber and corporate partners like Sky, Coinbase and Vodafone. Together we’re helping millions of people around the world store, send and spend value like never before.


We recognise that building a world class business requires a world class effort, so we make sure that each team member is appreciated for the unique value and skills they bring. We are driven by the knowledge that there are still millions of businesses and consumers (in a £600 billion industry!) that we can help. If you’re looking for an environment that will inspire you to dream bigger, work harder and make a difference every day, you’re in the right place.


Role


In this role you will be responsible for closing monthly SaaS revenue deals by understanding the needs and buying process of prospective corporate partners and demonstrating the value and ROI of the WeGift platform.


Responsibilities



  • Initiate proactive discovery processes with prospective leads to qualify timing, organisational technical and commercial fit.

  • Proactively analyse and evaluate discovery and sales calls to continually improve the sales process, feeding back to the wider team.

  • Educate prospective partners on the benefits of digital gift cards, technology as a service and monthly pricing as a commercial model.

  • Build ROI calculators and commercials models to assist the partner in their commercial decision.

  • Gather key commercial, technical and contractual requirements as part of the closing and on-boarding process.

  • Working closely with Implementation and Customer Success Managers to assist with successful customer launches.

  • Evaluating your own process and the wider teams and continually feeding back to iterate and refine the sales process.

  • Ensure CRM, sales notes, and reporting data is clean, precise and up to date.


Requirements



  • 3+ years enterprise SaaS or PaaS B2B sales experience.

  • Proven track record of selling to mid-market and enterprise customers with minimum contract values of £20k per annum.

  • Proven record of delivering month-on-month sales growth, with a decreasing sales cycle and an increasing close rate.


 


What’s in for you?


We believe there is a clear distinction between perks and benefits. Perks are easily replicable, whereas benefits are something that are unique to us. We have taken the time to tailor a number of them to fit our culture and ethos.


Compensation



  • £40-60k basic

  • £40-60k annual performance bonus (paid quarterly based on objectives)


Benefits



  • Participation in the Employee Options pool so you get to own a piece of WeGift.

  • Pension scheme (3% contribution)

  • Staff perks with WeGift brands - discounts of up to 12% on coffee, weekly groceries, holidays, the list is endless.

  • Flexible hours and work from home when needed - yes, yes everyone says this but we do.

  • A minimum of 25 days holiday + bank holidays (we’re not too descriptive about holidays so if you need more time off then just ask).

  • WeRecognise, where we shine the spotlight on exceptional employees every month who in turn get a £200 award in the eGift card of their choice.

  • Personal development budget - well actually there is no budget as we don’t believe in putting a cap on learning new things.

  • Generous maternity and paternity packages to make sure you get to spend time with your new bundle of joy.

  • Cycle to work scheme - save some £££ on buying a bike

  • Fully licensed as a tier 2 sponsor + relocation packages to help you get settled in.


Perks



  • Brand new WeWork office based in Monument, London or an uber cool Central Working space in Cambridge.

  • Catered team lunches every two weeks minimum.

  • Monthly team socials (Escape Rooms, Karaoke - everyone gets a chance to choose what this looks like)


We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.


 


Successful candidates will be contacted within two weeks.

About MyTutor


One-to-one tuition is proven to significantly improve pupils’ grades, confidence and life chances. Yet it remains out of reach for many. MyTutor’s mission is to bring life-changing tuition to all. Our handpicked network of tutors work online with pupils from all walks of life, and we’ve given over a quarter of a million lessons so far – raising results on average by one whole grade. We’re proud of the fact that over 400 schools have also chosen to work with us. And that we’ve earned a Trustpilot rating of 9.4/10.


 


We understand the hectic lives of families with teenagers, and our flexible lesson times mean parents can juggle schedules more easily. On our website, it’s simple to find a tutor your child gets on with – and every lesson is tailored to their needs. Also, by having lessons via live video, pupils can access the best tutors no matter where they live or when they need help. No travelling for Mum and Dad, no waiting around, no strangers in your home. Pupils can have their lessons anywhere – at Grandma’s, at a friend’s house or on holiday, so there’s no disruption in the run-up to exams.


 


Tuition is now more affordable and accessible, making life less stressful for busy parents doing their best.


 


About the role


 


As a Part Time Sales Associate, you will be responsible for contacting parents and helping them get started with a tutor on the platform. No previous experience working in education is necessary; we have amazing in-house specialists and top talent from the industry to train you!


 


 


What you’ll do


 



  • Contact parents - who have created an account but who have not booked a tutor - via phone, email and live chat

  • Pitch our service and help match the parent with a tutor for an introductory Free Meeting

  • Build relationships with your leads and advise them on how to get started on MyTutor

  • Follow up with previously matched parents and act as an account manager to help them book their first lesson

  • Identify opportunities to improve operational efficiency and provide feedback on trends and patterns of parent requests

  • Work with the Customer Experience Manager to continuously iterate on communication and processes, to ensure we are providing the best service for parents, and the best results for the business

  • Collaborate with the rest of the team to meet targets and support each other

  • Work flexible shifts covering a variety of evenings (4pm-8pm) and weekends (Saturday and Sunday, shifts available between 9am-7pm)


 


Requirements


 



  • You love the idea of helping parents find the perfect tutor to help their child succeed

  • You have some experience working with customers in previous roles

  • You’re an excellent communicator who is at ease empathising with customer needs and feels driven to help others

  • You’re confident working with each parent on a one-to-one basis, ensuring their specific questions and concerns are addressed.

  • You’re able to feedback collaboratively and effectively across teams

  • You’re tech savvy - comfortable with using our in-house CRM solution and live chat

  • You are a team player - you work efficiently with a team to achieve team targets, whilst ensuring attention to detail and quality of service


 


Benefits


 



  • Helping to improve the educational outcomes of thousands of young people

  • A work atmosphere that encourages collaboration and support

  • Opportunity to work autonomously and make use of your creative flair

  • Training and investment in your learning

  • £10 an hour base rate, with competitive commission based on results

  • Team training days and flexible working hours


 


MyTutor is committed to creating an inclusive workplace and have set up our own EDI (Equality, Diversity and Inclusion) committee who host regular events to make sure we live up to those values. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and all applicants will be considered.

items.title: B2B Sales Executive
items.content:
About Good Escapes:


A travel discovery and booking platform with a focus on wellness vacations & experiences.


The Role


Good Escapes is seeking a B2B sales professional. The ideal candidate is interested in wellness tourism and the benefits of corporate retreats. Someone who is a motivated self-starter and can learn quickly and work without direct supervision will be able to excel in this position and grow rapidly within the company. The potential is limitless as every company is a potential client. This is a remote position. You will be provided with training on the industry, company, and sales procedure. You will be responsible for prospecting, cold calling + emailing and closing leads. The position offers uncapped commission. Earnings should exceed 6 figures in the first year.


Requirements:


1+ years of experience in a trip planning role, luxury travel market preferred but not required.


B2B sales experience a plus Creative, passionate about travel, demonstrated ability to create exceptional itineraries.


Experience working with cross-cultural and geographically dispersed teams.


Experience in fast-paced, start-up environments preferred.


Hospitality experience, particularly luxury market preferred. Highly polished communication skills, skillful writer and researcher.


Strong knowledge of geography and international destinations with a focus on Asia.


Responsible and highly organized, with an ability to prioritize time-sensitive assignments. Written and spoken foreign language skills (particularly French, Mandarin, German) preferred.


Next Steps: Send us your resume and cover letter. Check out Good Escapes, choose a retreat and include a brief example of how you will pitch a corporate retreat/offsite to companies in your application.

items.content:
Lydia is one of Europe’s fastest-growing fintech start-ups. Our mission is to make payments as simple as possible. How? By providing one app to pay for everything in all situations - from paying back a friend for last night’s pizza to buying lunch at a food market.


We launched Lydia in Paris in 2013, and we are now the number one mobile payments service in France. We have over 2 million users across France, the UK, Ireland, Spain, and Portugal, and more than 100,000 people create an account every month.


We’re looking for entrepreneurial, highly motivated talent to join our mission to become Europe’s universal means of payment. You will be working closely with the UK and Ireland teams to continue Lydia’s expansion into the UK market. Your tasks will include key aspects of growing Lydia’s user-base in the UK.


 


RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE


Identify business development opportunities in the UK’s student sector


Conducting the whole sales cycle from prospecting, signing accounts, account management, and upselling


Event planning and organisation


Social media management: assisting in creating content for the Lydia social media channels (Facebook, Twitter and Instagram). 


Organising marketing projects


Creating marketing collateral documents


Contributing to social media strategy


 


REQUIREMENTS


Native or fluent in English (spoken and written), knowledge of French is a plus


Recent graduate with excellent knowledge of the UK student market


Extremely well-organised, detail-oriented, rigorous 


Creative problem-solver with an analytical mindset


Proactive self-starter that can take initiative and seizes any challenge, no matter how big or small


Ability to multitask, can work under pressure


Excellent communication skills 


 


BENEFITS


The opportunity to work at one of France’s fastest growing start-ups


Have a real impact on the company’s growth and evolution in a new market


Training in our Paris office


 


Start date: immediate 


Compensation: according to experience


Contract type: freelance


Location: UK, remote

items.content:
Who are we?


Formisimo is an award-winning start-up based in Manchester. We were incubated at Europe’s leading startup accelerator Seedcamp, and we’re used by thousands of companies Worldwide including Capital One, Sainsbury's Bank, Uber, The New Zealand Government and Experian.


Formisimo is changing the way that companies design online forms and checkouts. Using market-leading technology, we help online brands understand their website visitors and how they engage with online forms. We give them the insight they need to improve their online user experience and help transform their businesses as a result.


What to expect



  • Working alongside a co-founder to be the first point of contact for our international Enterprise client base - helping them get set up with our product and ensuring they continue to get huge value from it in the long term

  • You'll be building strong, long term relationships with our clients, and the companies they work in. We aim to make our clients lives easier and to help our clients' companies grow

  • You’ll also understand that onboarding customers is a vital part of the experience of using a product and so everything within your power to ensure our customers love our product

  • Getting to know a technical product inside out, and be able to troubleshoot quickly and effectively for new customers (full training on this will be provided)

  • Your ideas to be taken seriously and valued

  • To work with talented and motivated people

  • To have the space and autonomy to manage your own workload and priorities, and be able to enact your ideas and improve on our current way of doing things

  • All the incredible experiences of working at a startup - dizzying highs, and buckle-down-lows, but never boring

  • A focussed, productive work environment, but not a stressful one


Responsibilities


The Account Manager is the primary point of contact for our customers and is the human face of our fantastic product, Zuko. We’re proud of our customer service, and it’s a reason why our clients work with us and stay with us long term. You’ll manage all client relationships and own the entire customer life cycle post-sale, including:



  • Onboarding new clients and users, helping them understand how to get the most from our platform

  • Be the first point of contact for technical issues, solving them where possible, or escalating larger issues to the technical team

  • Hold regular workshops and update calls with clients to ensure they understand their data, have noticed any new trends and ensure they are using the product to its full potential

  • Manage and own retention and upselling - it will be your responsibility to ensure customers see value in the product and want to continue to benefit from it

  • All billing and invoicing for clients

  • Being the voice of the customer inside Formisimo, helping our product development team understand the needs and wants of our clients and help shape the future functionality of our platform.

  • Opportunities to write and input into content related to our platform and our area of expertise, online forms and how to make them better.


Who are you?



  • You’re a great people person, with an ability to create and nurture relationships quickly and maintain those relationships over time

  • You have extremely capable communication skills, both written and verbal. We communicate with our customers both via Intercom, email and on calls and in-person

  • You have strong attention to detail - typos in emails will annoy you

  • You are great at time management - often you’ll be juggling multiple clients and many urgent issues and tasks

  • You’re a self-starter and will look to be constantly improving how you work and not be afraid to voice opinions about how processes and approaches could be improved

  • You will be excited about joining an early-stage startup, and the potential to grow with Formisimo

  • You are comfortable working in an environment not restricted by excessive processes and clear job roles - you’ll often be doing tasks for the first time and building a process as you go

  • You’ll not be afraid of getting stuck into a technical product. Full training will be provided, but you will be helping customers install and troubleshoot code on their site.


Experience



  • Extensive experience working in a fast-paced, client-facing environment

  • Working with large (Enterprise) organisations in a previous role would be beneficial (Previous work within an agency on client work will be a huge plus)

  • Be adept at managing multiple priorities

  • You will have dealt with both positive and challenging client situations, and be adept at understanding a customer's needs and responding accordingly

  • You’ll have a track record of building relationships with customers keeping in regular contact with them, and getting to understand their businesses and their problems

  • Familiarity with CRMs and time management tools such as Intercom, Trello and Slack


What we offer



  • Flexible working hours and remote working - our team structure their days around what works for them, including those with families

  • A new device of your choice (PC/Windows Laptop/Macbook)

  • Autonomy, ownership and a flat management structure mean your opinions will be listened to and you’ll have a big impact from the start

  • Free car parking

  • Weekly company breakfasts, twice-annual team nights that aren't alcohol focused

  • A high level of company transparency - salaries, company profit and loss, budgets and more are all shared in our open and honest working environment

  • A close-knit, focussed and productive team

  • Annual share-option bonus scheme

  • Work with leading brands like Capital One, Experian and DFS

  • Location: MediaCity, Salford, UK

  • Salary: £35k (+ share options)

items.title: Paid internship: Business Development Associate - Germany focus
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, base, resid) 3W OR(berlin, london, pari)
items.content:
KeyNest is a fast-growing global network of shops where Airbnb hosts and Property Managers can securely store their keys so that their guests / cleaners / contractors can pick them up whenever is convenient for them.

We are a global partner of Airbnb and have checked-in more than 100,000 guests. We already have a presence in 8 countries and are now launching in the DACH region. 


To make this a success, we’re looking for an ambitious International Business Development Associate to grow our network of KeyNest Stores in Germany, Austria and Switzerland and help us with our overall strategy for the DACH region.

This is a paid 4-6-months internship based in London.

The role:
• Recruit new Stores to join the KeyNest partner programme in Germany, Austria and Switzerland
• Assist with customer requests
• Build, manage and maintain a sales pipeline to follow up on leads
• Liaise with our international customers to find the best suitable partner
• Train and/or mystery shop our partner Stores where required in London and remotely for international partner Stores
• Demonstrate an in-depth knowledge of our product offering to customers


Who we are looking for:
• Excellent communication and outgoing personality
• Available to travel extensively in and around London and occasionally outside / international
• Pro-active, self-motivated and work well in a team environment style
• Native German speaker + fluent English required (company language is English), knowledge of other languages a plus
• Experience as an Airbnb host / guest is a plus
• Available for 4 months minimum


What we offer:
• Weekly salary payment
• Unique chance to make your mark in a dynamic and very fast-growing company shaking up the sharing economy
• Sales training to help you succeed in your role
• Possibility to be hired full-time or to continue working remotely whilst at university
• Central London office


If you want to join the KeyNest team, please get in touch at careers@keynest.com – we look forward to meeting you.

items.title: Sales Associate
items.content:
Overview


Settled was founded on the belief that there needs to be a progressive change in the real-estate sector. We're on a mission to put a smile on the faces of everyone buying or selling a home by building next-generation products and software.


As well as being led by former Google execs, Settled is venture capital backed by firms including 500.co, Piton Capital, Accelerated Digital Ventures and Connect Ventures. We're at that exciting stage where our business is growing rapidly and we're focused on building a team who'll be part of our journey for the years ahead.


People are at the heart of everything we do and we spend a lot of time thinking about our team and our culture. We love working with smart, creative thinkers who are passionate about collaborating and making a difference.


The Sales Associate will work to shape the strategy for and help deliver Settled’s ambitious sales and growth targets. Working cross-functionally with Growth, Operations, and Product, they will drive optimisation of the sales funnels whilst managing their own pipeline.


Responsibilities



  • Successful management of a sales pipeline. What this means specifically in the current model:

    • Managing the lead relationship, from qualification to closing. 

    • Handling inbound sales enquiries via phone, email, and live chat.

    • Being the first point of contact for all seller leads after they’ve signed up to Settled, and buyer leads after they’ve shown interest in a Settled home.

    • Managing a smooth transition to relationship managers post lead-close.



  • Identifying any pipeline inefficiencies and removing any bottlenecks.

  • Working with the Head of Growth and an extensive understanding of both Settled’s seller and buyer funnels they will drive optimisation to maximise conversion.

  • Providing input and shaping sales strategy for both new and existing markets.


Requirements



  • 1-2 years experience in B2C sales, someone ideally looking to take the next step in their career, looking for more responsibility and wanting to make a real influence in the industry

  • Dedication, passion, commitment and hard-work goes a long way with us!

  • A real team-player, we don't work in silos and advocate transparency

  • An analytical mindset, knowing the importance of data-driven decisions and able to prioritise effectively

  • Experience in a start-up and/or Proptech desirable but not essential


Perks



  • All employees are invited to participate in our EMI scheme

  • Access to Perks at Work

  • Your birthday off!

  • Pension Scheme

  • Apple Macbook

  • Company socials

  • Company swag

  • Dog-friendly office


Settled is a high-paced, dynamic company. Our employees are all passionate about making a real disruption to the property market for the benefit of our customers, and we're a team of people that like to have fun both in and out of work.


Some of the things to expect from us:



  • Bad jokes

  • Bad taste in music

  • Bad singing

  • But overall...we really help one another, work closely with each other and have fun doing so!

items.title: Sales Development Representative
items.content:
Company Description


Outpost24 is a leading cyber assessment company focused on enabling its customers to achieve maximum value from their evolving technology investments. By leveraging our full stack security insights to reduce attack surface for any architecture, Outpost24 customers continuously improve their security posture with the least effort. Over 2,000 customers in more than 40 countries around the world trust Outpost24 to assess their devices, networks, applications, cloud and container environments and report compliance status for government, industry sector, or internal regulations. Founded in 2001, Outpost24 serves leading organizations across a wide range of segments including financial and insurance, government, healthcare, retail, telecommunications, technology, and manufacturing.


 


Position


Do you love building relationships? Are you passionate about sales? Would you like the opportunity to work in one of the fastest growing industries? Then here’s your chance!


Outpost24 is looking for a dedicated Sales Development Representative. Your main focus will be to generate leads and contact new customer prospects for new business.  You will create and maintain a solid new business pipeline by identifying new business opportunities – including growth areas, trends, customers, products and services.  You will be responsible for a smooth and efficient transition from the new business stage (onboarding phase) to the account management stage (customer success journey).


You will be an important player for the growth of Outpost24 in the Germany, Austria and Switzerland (DACH region); therefore, we see that you are target driven.


Your responsibilities include:



  • Reaching out to potential customer through customized and personal communication (Cold calling / Social Selling)

  • Conduct in-bound and out-bound campaign calling activities to business prospects in assigned territory

  • First point of contact of prospective clients for the DACH region

  • Maintain sales activities and data in Salesforce

  • Identify new business opportunities

  • Negotiate pricing with potential customers

  • Understand the need of your customers and being able to respond effectively with a plan of how to meet our customer’s needs

  • Reviewing your own sales performance, aiming to meet or exceed targets set by the Company.


 


Requirements


The ideal candidate has 1-3 years’ experience working with new business development (B2B experience), preferably experience in the IT-security or IT-industry, holds a bachelor’s degree (preferably within Economics, IT or Engineering). We see that you have a real “hunter” spirit with high ambitions to get things done, you are goal and result driven.  You agree with our sales team values – Deliver results, customer dedication and think big – and can give us examples of how you live by these values. It will be considered an advantage if you are used to working with MS Office and Salesforce.


You are described as entrepreneurial, networker, team player and social. You have excellent communication skills in person, mail and phone.  You want to belong to a team of professionals who enjoys having fun at work and you wish to be a part of fast-growing, cutting edge cyber security company.


We see that you are fluent in German and English as this is the corporate language. The position is home based. As part of the recruitment process you must be able to pass a background check in order to qualify for this position.  Please do not delay in applying as we will close down the position once the right candidate is found.


 


Other information


We welcome you to a challenging, innovative environment with great opportunities for you to grow.



  • We offer you a competitive salary together with a commission opportunity.

  • Elaborative set of tools to drive your career, training and coaching on the job.

  • Healthy work-life balance, which means you can enjoy flexible working hours.

  • International, innovative team where you really matter

  • Possibility to expense gym membership

  • Enrollment in our pension scheme

  • Great development opportunities


Do you feel this role is for you? Please don’t hesitate to send in your application as soon as possible.


This position will remain open for application until the role is filled.


This position will remain open for application until the role is filled. Please do not delay in applying as we will close down the position once the right candidate is found.

items.content:

Outpost24 is a leading cyber assessment company focused on enabling its customers to achieve maximum value from their evolving technology investments. By leveraging our full stack security insights to reduce attack surface for any architecture, Outpost24 customers continuously improve their security posture with the least effort. Over 2,000 customers in more than 40 countries around the world trust Outpost24 to assess their devices, networks, applications, cloud and container environments and report compliance status for government, industry sector, or internal regulations. Founded in 2001, Outpost24 serves leading organizations across a wide range of segments including financial and insurance, government, healthcare, retail, telecommunications, technology, and manufacturing.


 


Position


Do you love building relationships? Are you passionate about sales? Would you like the opportunity to work in one of the fastest growing industries? Then here’s your chance!


Outpost24 is looking for a dedicated Key Account Manager for New Business with the drive to meet ambitious targets and increase our market share. You will be responsible for securing success for Outpost24 in their defined regional markets towards medium and large sized enterprises. Together with our Sales Development Representative and the Regional Sales Director, you will be executing growth and account management.


You will be an important player for the growth of Outpost24 in the Germany, Austria and Switzerland (DACH region); therefore, we see that you are target driven.


Your responsibilities include:



  • Create, develop and execute strategies for acquiring new accounts

  • Develop long-term partnerships with targeted accounts that result in increased sales and margins

  • Reaching out to potential customer through customized and personal communication (Cold calling / Social Selling)

  • Maintain sales activities and data in Salesforce

  • Understanding customer's diverse and specific business needs and gathering product knowledge to meet those needs

  • Ensuring high quality of service by developing a thorough and detailed knowledge of technical specifications and other features of employer's systems and processes

  • Identifying opportunities for further sales for development through detailed research of the specific industry or market

  • Preparing and delivering customer presentations and demonstrations of the software, with clarity and confidence

  • Meeting quarterly and yearly targets set by management and contributing to team targets

  • Providing technical advice via our technical staff to customers on all aspects of the installation

  • Providing support to customers, offering clear advice and solutions wherever possible

  • Significant interaction with clients, both face-to-face, online and over the telephone


 


Requirements


The ideal candidate has 3 - 5 years’ experience working with new business development (B2B experience), has recent experience in the IT-industry, holds a bachelor’s degree (preferably within Economics, IT or Engineering). We see that you have a real "hunter" spirit with high ambitions to get things done, you are goal and result driven. You have an excellent track record in the field of cold calling and it's an advantage if you are used to working with MS Office and Salesforce.

Other information

  • Elaborative set of tools to drive your career, training and coaching on the job.

  • International, innovative team where you really matter

  • Possibility to expense gym membership

items.content:
At Chattermill we use cutting-edge AI technology to give leading companies the key to improving their customer experience.  We work with many of the most exciting companies in the world (Uber, HelloFresh, Transferwise, Skyscanner, and Deliveroo to name a handful!) and are passionate about helping them put their customers’ at the heart of their decision making.


In four short years, we’ve grown from two co-founders to a team of 40 (and counting) bright and diverse individuals.  We have big plans and are now looking for a Sales Development Representative to join us as an integral member of our Sales team.  The Sales Development Representative will be the initial voice of our sales process and will work to identify and qualify new opportunities for partnerships with Chattermill.  They will work in tandem with our Account Executives and Growth team and have a fantastic opportunity to develop their career in sales.


As a Sales Development Representative, you will:



  • Build and develop strong relationships with prospective clients 

  • Use your holistic knowledge of the company’s product and service offering to act as an ambassador and advisor to potential clients

  • Perform regular prospective outreach using a variety of channels including over the phone, email, and social media

  • Support marketing efforts and follow up on inbound leads garnered from the company website, events, and campaigns

  • Develop an excellent knowledge of the customer experience space by performing market research and staying up to date with industry movements 

  • Develop and implement your own outbound campaigns to develop your territory and key targeted accounts 

  • Work closely with the Account Executive and Growth team to achieve overall commercial targets


What we’re looking for:



  • A collaborative team player who cares deeply about the success of the wider business

  • Strong emotional intelligence and interpersonal skills, a customer-centric and consultative approach to working

  • Exceptional communication skills, both verbal and written

  • The ability to ask effective questions, listen actively and analyse key information 

  • The ability to identify and address the needs of prospective clients

  • Resourcefulness and the ability to find impactful information and approaches

  • The ability to tell stories using data and craft effective messaging and content

  • An understanding of Customer Experience and what makes a great customer journey

  • You’re digitally savvy and have the ability to embrace and master new technology

  • You have a “can-do” attitude and take the initiative to develop both the business and your career

  • You’re adaptable, coachable, and driven to continuously improve and strengthen your skillset


Nice to have:



  • Prior experience in sales development in a SaaS or B2B environment

  • Startup experience (including in unrelated field)

  • Degree level of education


Why join us?



  • A competitive salary and on target earnings

  • Great progression opportunities - we want you to grow with us!

  • 25 days holiday (in addition to bank holidays)

  • A big focus on personal development including a £500 development budget and biweekly Breakfast and Learns

  • Perks including discounts on cinema tickets, utilities and more

  • Flexible working conditions and the opportunity to work from home

  • Lovely office (with great coffee, events, and a rooftop terrace) 

  • Office wellness events like Monday Mindfulness and yoga

  • Quarterly Company Socials planned by our great colleagues!

items.title: Sales & Reservations Executive (Spanish Speaking)
items.content:
*This role requires someone with fluency or a professional working standard in the Spanish Language*


The Company


The Plum Guide is building a marketplace of the world’s best short-term rental homes.


We are taking a systematic and obsessive approach to testing every single home on the planet, accepting only the top 1%. We do so by putting each home through The Plum Test: a gruelling hospitality exam, which uses a mix of algorithms and physical visits by hospitality experts. 


We launched three years ago in London. We are now in 12 cities, we have vetted over 100,000 homes and are on track to reach over £25M in annualised sales. We are backed by an all-star cast investor group including Local Globe (TransferWise, Citymapper), Alex Chesterman (Founder of Zoopla), William Reeve (Founder of Love Film), Alex Saint and Troy Collins (Founders of Secret Escapes), Jason Goodman (Founder of Albion) and many more. 


We are launching our global rollout strategy and growing our exceptional Team.


 


The Mission


The mission for our MatchMakers is to match our Guests with the perfect Plum home for their stay. 


The Role


MatchMakers make the magic happen - you will handle inbound requests from our Guests. You will speak to them on the phone, on chat and by email. If you think they should stay in a hotel and not with us, then you should tell them. You will need to really understand their needs, their style and what they will love. You need to be speedy, able to multi-task and focus. 


Your targets will include:




  • Hit sales targets of 3X growth




  • Increase conversion every month 




  • Ensure Plum Guests are happy 




You will be part of a friendly, hard-working, competitive team and working in an environment that is focused on learning, improving and delivering. 


As we are growing, we are keen to add more language skills to the team. It is essential for you to be fluent or skilled to a professional working standard in Spanish. 


Our office is open 7 days a week and schedules vary.


About You



  • Are excited about being part of a rapidly growing business. 


  • Have sales or travel experience


  • Are a positive person and understand what exceptional customer service is. 


  • Availability to work full-time across a varied schedule on a permanent contract 


  • Speak Spanish fluently/to a professional working standard.


  • Have great city knowledge or Barcelona and/or Madrid (not essential but preferable). 


We are open to people of all backgrounds so if you're unsure please do apply.

items.title: Gatekeeper: Account Executive EMEA for SAAS Solution, REMOTE (UK)
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, anywher, base, resid) 7W OR(germani, unitedkingdom, austria, croatia, hrvatska, denmark, franc, ireland, netherland, spain, sweden, switzerland)
items.content:
Account Executive EMEA for SAAS Solution, REMOTE (UK)

 
THE COMPANY

Gatekeeper is a SaaS-based, next-generation solution that transforms how organisations manage their suppliers and contracts. We help our customers to reduce risk, improve compliance and maximise value.

Due to strong global growth, we're opening the doors for new Account Executives (Inside sales) to join the team. This is a rare chance to join a true technology startup, working with a close-knit team to create new business processes, uncover new opportunities and position yourself for success and rapid career progression.

A sales career at Gatekeeper might not be for everyone. We hire a small percentage of the people who walk through our door. If that doesn’t put you off - you might just have what it takes to join us in the exciting times ahead.

Note: This is a remote position, so your physical location can be anywhere in the UK.


ABOUT YOU:
  • Are you a sales focussed problem solver, with an incredible ability to listen, understand, build rapport and close new customers?
  • Do you want to work in a fast-moving, fast-growing, fast-talking start up and have uncapped earning potential?
  • Do you have what it takes to deliver value over and above expectations on a consistent basis?

DO NOT apply for this job if:
  • You are not fanatically focused on a data-driven sales to consistently exceed quota for uncapped personal gain
  • You ever consider mediocrity acceptable
  • You need to be told what to do
  • You want to be the smartest person in the (virtual) room
  • Don’t like working with the best and learning something new everyday
  • You have an ego bigger than your sense of humour


If this role feels like a fit, read our Vision & Values. Only If they excite and inspire you to join our team and culture then, please, read on.


IN THIS ROLE, YOU WILL:
  • Sell our solution to Mid-Market and Enterprise customers
  • Nail your Quota
  • Maximise all inbound leads (SQLs & MQLs) using a systems and Sales Playbook mindset
  • Research prospective customers, create outreach strategies, and identify sales opportunities.
  • Connect and conduct exploratory conversations with potential customers.
  • Conduct needs qualification calls with specific prospects
  • Grow an account base with targeted upsell and cross sell campaigns
  • Manage the renewal process within your account base
  • Working with the product team to feedback customer driven feature requests 

 
YOUR QUALITIES
  • A minimum of 3 years of SaaS sales experience, ideally in a startup, selling similar solutions, with an ACV of > £15K
  • A borderline unhealthy obsession with exceeding your quota by maximising leads and consistently increasing ACV over time (no money left on the table)
  • A ‘Sales Playbook’ mindset to ensure consistent, predictable improvement through open sharing and teamwork
  • A data-driven mindset: you eat, breathe and sleep core sales metrics
  • A focus on Buyer Persona’s and Verticals to uncover rich veins of new business
  • An encyclopedic knowledge of SaaS sales blogs and best-practice
  • The ability to manage multiple work streams without dropping the ball (or bitching)
  • A sense of humour and lust of life 
 
HOW GATEKEEPER SUPPORTS YOU
  • Work remotely: Live & work wherever you like - no more commutes
  • Flexible hours: Design your working time to meet your lifestyle
  • Technology: Get hooked up with a laptop, monitor and headphones to do your best work
  • Gatekeeper Retreats: Join us on annual (or more frequent) GK Gatherings
  • Learning & development budget: to support our lifetime learners we offer financial support for courses, books and events
  • Health: stay fit and healthy - reimbursement for a gym membership or any other well-being activity
  • Uncapped earning potential with access to our metric driven sales methodology
  • Thorough product and sales training to equip you with the tools to succeed

items.content:
*Licensed Inbound Sales Representative - Work From Home - Houston, TX (REQUIRED: must live within 60 miles of Houston, TX)*
We are seeking those that have an active insurance license to join our team as a inbound sales rep working remotely from your home. On our team, you'll be taking inbound calls from customers interested in buying insurance.*NO COLD CALLING!*
*.
We'll provide you with office equipment and training virtually so that you can feel confident you're providing the best possible customer service while still in a work from home environment. As the voice of Progressive to our customers, you'll explain policy coverage and sell insurance products and services. You'll have the support of a virtual, collaborative team, which includes ongoing coaching and development.
*2019 Training Start Dates & Schedule:*
*.Start Date: November 4, 2019 or January 27, 2020*
*.Training Hours:*Monday - Friday, 10:00am - 6:45pm (EST)
*.Work Schedule Options:*Choose from 3 schedule options with start times between 8:00 a.m. - 12:00 p.m. local time including one weekend day
*Duties & Responsibilities:*
* Build trust by understanding the unique needs of our customers, and offering the best insurance solutions to meet those needs
* Educate customers on our insurance products and services while identifying opportunities to sell additional products
*.
*Qualifications:*
* Must live within 60 miles of Houston, TX
* Active Personal Lines or Property & Casualty (P&C) license
* One or more years of college education or relevant work experience
* Work or educational experience must include:
o Customer service, sales and/or influencing others
o Fast paced and changing environment
o Multitasking and time management skills
o Effectively communicating verbally and in writing
o Computer skills
*Prefer previous remote work experience and/or contact center experience*
*.
*Pay Rate: $16.00 -$19.00 per hour*, plus:
* Additional 10% shift differential pay when you work evenings or weekends
* Top performance awards and contests with cash payouts
*Benefits & Perks:*
Progressive offers the confidence and stability that comes with working for a growing, always evolving organization. Progressive employees also benefit from:
* Annual gainshare bonus of up to 16% of your salary; Progressive rewards each of us with an annual bonus based on company performance
* 401k which includes dollar-for-dollar company match of up to 6%
* Paid training, tuition assistance and career development
* Diverse, welcoming culture with Employee Resource Groups
* Dedication to work/life balance including beginning to earn paid time off after your first two weeks
* Wellness program with discounts & rewards and the standard benefits (medical, dental, vision)
*Work From Home Office Details:*
* Designated workspace that is free from noise and other distractions and allows for dedicated focus
* Remote office Internet connection should be via DSL or Cable Modem with minimum speed of 1mbps down and 0.5mbps up.
* Your computer or Router should be physically connected to the modem by a cable. No wireless connection
* All Progressive hardware you receive needs to be connected to a surge protector
*Apply Today!*
Equal Opportunity Employer
VIRTUALINBOUNDSALES
*Job:*.*Contact Center*
*Title:*.Inbound Sales Representative - Work From Home*
*Location:*.Texas-Houston*
*Requisition ID:*.160973*

items.title: iZooto: Sales Development Representative (SDR)
items.content:
Sales Development Representative (SDR)

 We are looking for an entrepreneurial, ambitious Sales Development Representative for the North American market. This is a full-time, 100% remote position. This position comes with a very good base salary plus generous commissions and medical insurance.
 
●      Generate revenue by working through pre-qualified leads 
●      Present & demonstrate our solutions to customers via phone/web meetings. 
●      Work cross-functionally with marketing in order to drive revenue for the company 
●      Build your sales pipeline of all opportunities through Leads and Campaigns and update on a weekly basis. Own and drive at least 3X pipeline targets on a monthly basis. 
●      Strategic probing to identify, evaluate, and recommend alternative business solutions. 
●      Maintain up-to-date knowledge of the company’s competitive positioning in the marketplace. 
●      Managing pipelines and moving opportunities along the sales cycle to closure. 
●      Follow-up on Marketing-generated leads in order to qualify them in an efficient manner, and ensure high translation of lead to revenue. 
●      Periodic Reporting to the Manager. Be Accountable for the accuracy of reporting.

items.title: Customer Relationship Manager (Software / Digital Transformation)
items.content:
About Steer73 


Steer73 are a Digital Transformation Agency. We work with a wide variety of clients to understand their needs, shape their product and to deliver their development work. In many cases we are the client’s in-house product, design and development team.  


Our HQ is in London, UK. We have teams in Ukraine and India, plus people working in various other locations around the world. We are a modern business that benefits from a remote and distributed global team. 


The role 


We are looking for a Customer Relationship Manager (CRM) who will be comfortable in a cross-functional sales, marketing, and account management role that supports all parts of the commercial business. You will report into the Operations Director and will be expected to support both the Product and Managing Director with their account relationships.  


You will be expected to provide operational and scheduling support to our Senior Management team, as well as be able to proactively manage a wide range of tasks at short notice. Your key area of focus will be on lead generation and sales, ensuring that we have a strong pipeline of future business. 


Steer73 are growing quickly with staff numbers doubling in the last 24 months and an ambition to scale the company to over 100 employees in the coming few years. With this growth the business will require a strong CRM to support the Senior Management team. 


You will be eager to learn and develop, have some previous experience in a customer facing role and be passionate about driving change and innovation through a culture of continuous improvement. 


Key tasks 


On a typical day you will be working on various administrative, sales, marketing and customer related related tasks: 



  • Email marketing management: responding to email marketing leads 

  • Lead management: following up on leads and managing the sales lead pipeline 

  • Content management: managing copywriting content for the company website 

  • Engagement: bolstering client engagement across our accounts 

  • Account management: maintaining the account management board and ensuring the tasks are completed  

  • Client review: following up with our customers after each piece of work is completed, e.g. after a project is completed / a sprint ends  

  • Issue resolution: dealing with any client concerns proactively 

  • Service reviews: identifying what services clients are on and opportunities for up sell 

  • Documentation: ensuring sign off documentation is done and delivered 

  • Communication: ensuring clients understand commercial deliverables 

  • Meeting arrangement: arranging client relationship / sales calls for the Managing Director and Product Director 


Required skills 


Core skills – you will be 



  • Pro-active and hardworking: you’re happy to run with tasks given to you and you’re able to prioritise accordingly. 

  • A strong communicator: you have excellent written and spoken English. 

  • Analytical and detail-oriented: you have a high attention to detail and a methodical work approach. 

  • Approachable and consultative: you believe that pride and ego must take a back seat to quality. You value influence over authority. You’re open to input and discussion from all members of the team. 


Company culture  


Steer73 is a small company and an important factor in our hiring is finding people who share our values and who will thrive in our business. 


We have a flat management structure and we look for people who want to get things done, are comfortable making decisions, take ownership of their roles, and want to progress. 


Joining Steer73 offers you the opportunity to work on high-profile and meaningful projects for a wide range of clients and industries, as part of a company with cross sectoral expertise.

items.title: Business Development Executive
tags: DBG:surround``3N( OR(feasibl,OR(consid,consider),option,occas,opportun,possibl,abil), OR(3N(remot, work),telecommut,2N(work,home)) ) NOT OR(regularli, abracadabra)
items.content:
Join the Growth Story at Envitia


We’re a software and services company on a growth trajectory with 25+ years of experience in delivering world-class location and data software and expertise to customers in the public and private sector.


Following a re-organisation last year, the company had a hugely successful 2018 – all down to an amazing group of people.  We’re now looking to grow and build a team that are hungry for success. We’re creating a culture that is fun, supportive yet challenging, and we’re looking for talented like-minded people to join us on this journey.  We’re also looking for people who are comfortable in challenging the norm so we can get truly diverse thinking when solving problems and not just senior management making decisions – we really believe in empowerment.


What do we do? In short, we solve complex data problems to help our customers make better and faster decisions. We do this through our team of data consultants who undertake cutting edge R&D projects or work with customers to find the best data modelling approach, architecture and standards so they’re able to make use of their data.  Or, through our software products where we enable customers to search for, and then visualise, data so they have great situational awareness and can make better decisions.


 


About the Role


Here at Envitia we’re on a success curve and we’re growing our teams across the business to reflect the exceptional reputation we have as creative, nimble solution-focused consultants.  This role is the very epitome of that reputation.  It’s a Hunter approach, through a consultative lens. Consistently demonstrating your ability to build insightful relationships with customers, understand key problems and respond as a Trusted Advisor.  You’ll be able to clearly identify and communicate the point of difference and value that Envitia brings to each unique project.


 


Key tasks include:



  • Build and pursue a pipeline of market opportunities in-line with the sales strategy

  • Work closely with our Business Development Managers to develop new customer relationships in order to deliver profitable new business growth through understanding their needs and requirements

  • Accurately forecast sales to agreed timescales against yearly and quarterly targets

  • Lead the full sales cycle from lead generation to proposal submission, negotiation and contract award

  • Effectively develop and manage proposals, bids and quotations to secure business

  • Identify marketing & PR opportunities linked to relevant markets, customers & opportunities

  • Liaise closely with Consultants and Engineering team for opportunities

  • Maintain accurate account plans & strategies

  • Maintain accurate weekly CRM updates & customer meeting notes

  • Engage in company-wide initiatives: be an Envitia Ambassador.


 


This is a role that will offer you ample opportunity to develop both your business development and technological understanding of complex data solutions.  You will be working with senior experts in their field and your potential career progression could be anywhere from managing a Business Development hub to Sales Director.


 


About You


You’re not looking for a standard 9-5 role.  You want the best of both worlds: a start-up mentality with disruptive thinking, but with the security of a profitable, larger company, with a solid customer base and financial stability. You believe you have the potential to succeed.  You want to push your boundaries but acknowledge that success comes through hard work, a positive attitude, and being surrounded by a great team that refuses to sit back and wait for opportunities to come to them.


 


You will need to demonstrate that you are passionate about what you do and that you drive success in your area.  You’re a dynamic and proactive BD Manager who thrives under pressure and always takes responsibility for developing new customers and accounts.


 


Essential Skills & Experience:



  • Some successful and demonstrable experience of solution sales, through a mix of software and services

  • Takes accountability and ownership. Demonstrable track record of working autonomously to build portfolio

  • Both strategic and tactical in thinking: capable of understanding the intricacies of Public Sector engagement

  • Effective user of a CRM to drive accurate and regular customer touch point/reporting and pipeline analysis.


 


Your Style:



  • Natural self-starter: positive and confident.  Highly resilient in the face of rejection or challenge

  • High EQ: confident communicating and influencing stakeholders and colleague at all levels.  Successfully engage with both technical and non-technical colleagues/clients

  • Really great communication skills both in spoken and written English

  • The ability to work independently and as part of a team

  • High attention to detail.


 


The Benefits:



  • Training & development to support you and your career

  • A great benefits package including medical & life insurance, attractive company pension

  • 25 days holiday plus your birthday as holiday!

  • Annual company bonus scheme (company and individual bonus)

  • Subsidised gym membership, with lunchtime circuit training three times a week

  • A casual work environment and flexible working with core hours 10:00 – 15:00. You tell us how you work best including the ability to work from home

  • Regular social events including “first of the month” drinks, monthly charity days, BBQ’s and much more

  • Employee recognition awards

  • Perkbox membership to help you with your everyday purchases!

Essential Skills & Experience:



  • Demonstrable success of solution sales, through a mix of software and services

  • Track record of leading the full sales cycle from lead generation to contract award for £500k+ opportunities

  • Consistent sales success: achieved annual sales target in excess of £2million

  • Takes accountability and ownership. Demonstrable track record of working autonomously to build portfolio

  • Both strategic and tactical in thinking: capable of understanding the intricacies of Public Sector engagement

  • Effective user of a CRM to drive accurate and regular customer touch point/reporting and pipeline analysis.


Desirable Skills & Experience:



  • Worked in Public Sector

  • Comfortable with technical solutions and software


Style:



  • Natural self-starter: positive and confident.  Highly resilient in the face of rejection or challenge

  • High EQ: confident communicating and influencing stakeholders and colleague at all levels.  Successfully engage with both technical and non-technical colleagues/clients

  • Really great communication skills both in spoken and written English

  • The ability to work independently and as part of a team

  • High attention to detail.


 


Security Clearance Requirements


Many of our public sector customers require UK Security Clearance as a mandated requirement. You’ll need to provide proof of identity, employment history and right to work in the UK, along with proof of UK residency, for at least five years.


The Benefits:



  • Training & development to support you and your career

  • A great benefits package including medical & life insurance, attractive company pension

  • 25 days holiday plus your birthday as holiday!

  • Annual company bonus scheme (company and individual bonus)

  • Subsidised gym membership, with lunchtime circuit training three times a week

  • A casual work environment and flexible working with core hours 10:00 – 15:00. You tell us how you work best including the ability to work from home

  • Regular social events including “first of the month” drinks, monthly charity days, BBQ’s and much more

  • Employee recognition awards

  • Perkbox membership to help you with your everyday purchases!

items.content:
Digital Producer, Account Manager at Coalition Technologies

Remote | International

We seek a professional Account Manager to add to our cross-functional team. To join Los Angeles’ best SEO company you must be highly talented with a desire to work in a fast-paced, startup environment. Our ideal Account Manager is an energetic and articulate digital marketing professional with a knack for project management and excellent customer service and interpersonal skills.

Required Skills and Abilities:
  • Articulate and efficient communicator
  • Excellent written communication skills, impeccable English grammar and mechanics
  • Confident, solid conflict-resolution and interpersonal skills
  • Strong analytical and project management skills, ability to juggle multiple projects concurrently without sacrificing quality of work
  • Outstanding organizational and time management skills
  • Keen eye for detail, ability to consistently spot and correct mistakes before our final products reach our clients
  • Flexible, adaptable, able to “see the big picture”, prioritize work, and meet tight deadlines
  • Proactive, dependable, trustworthy, optimistic, can-do attitude
  • Ability to gracefully receive, discuss, and implement feedback from peers, subordinates, management, and clients alike
  • Ability to explain technical processes to a non-technical audience
  • Great work ethic, punctual, and reliable
  • Ability to work full-time: Monday – Friday, 9 AM to 6 PM Pacific Time
Preferred Skills and Experience:
  • Previous account management or customer service experience
  • Experience creating and giving professional presentations, reporting to clients, and communicating with business executives
  • Quality assurance experience
  • Digital marketing skills and experience — SEO, SEM, etc.
  • Bachelor’s degree or better in marketing, business administration, computer science, or related field
  • Front and back-end web development skills — HTML5, CSS3, PHP, and JavaScript
  • Proficiency in several of these tools: Basecamp, Adobe Photoshop, Adobe Illustrator, SalesForce, Hootsuite, Screaming Frog, SEOmoz, MailChimp, Microsoft Office Suite, G Suite, WordPress, Shopify, Magento, BigCommerce, etc.
  • Google Adwords and/or Google Analytics certified
Responsibilities:
  • As one of our Account Managers you will orchestrate our clients’ digital marketing services, liaising between our different internal teams — design, development, copy, SEO, SEM, social media management, etc. — to complete deliverables on time, on budget, and always consistent with client branding, voice, and marketing objectives
  • Expertly identify and solve possible issues in client accounts, digital strategy, or deliverables
  • Be our last line of defence in quality assurance, ensure that deliverables, reports, and all client communications are 100% error free
  • Lead and/or actively participate in client calls and meetings to create initial digital marketing strategy, provide status updates, give presentations, and address client concerns
  • Be our clients’ champion and liaison with our team, provide outstanding customer service, and work diligently to help us maintain our high client retention rate
  • Stay up to date and knowledgeable of clients’ business, clients’ industry, and best digital marketing practices
  • Maintain client confidentiality and ensure secure keeping of clients’ information
  • Promote additional digital marketing services
  • Address client billing issues and ensure collection of payments for services rendered
Benefits:
  • Monthly bonus plan that distributes 50% of the company’s profits among all team members
  • Paid time off that grows with your time at the company
  • Medical, dental, vision, and life insurance
  • Subsidized gym membership
  • Competitive salary
Apply for job

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=8, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Our Story 


 


Founded in 2016 by Allan Baudoin and Bo van Langeveld, Baudoin & Lange designs, manufactures and sells high-end shoes for men and women.  


 


Allan Baudoin, a computer scientist and Apple alumni turned self-trained bespoke shoe maker, designed and handcrafted the first Sagan in 2014 as his own atelier shoes - hundreds of prototypes and two years of development later, the Sagan was born - instantly conquering the connoisseurs regulars of "the Row" with their supreme comfort, fit for a modern lifestyle.


 


When he and Bo van Langeveld, an ex-racing driver turned financier who was tired of suffering in his obligatory formal office shoes, met - they together developed the idea of a modern shoe brand that would combine the best of both worlds: comfort and style.


 


Our first staple product, the Sagan, is a supremely comfortable and versatile category defining loafer, featured in major publications and sold in over a hundred countries.  


 


We have been experiencing rapid online and offline growth, particularly in the US and Asian markets, where our stockists and partners range from high-end tailoring shops to the most renowned luxury department stores. 


 


To date, Baudoin & Lange benefited from compelling triple-digit organic growth; our customers are incredibly engaged with our brand and are our advocates, word-of-mouth has contributed significantly to discovery and we are one of the youngest companies to have firm partnerships with global luxury department stores (Harrods, Selfridges, Barney’s, Beams Japan etc) have been very successful.  Our social media engagement rates are high, and bloggers and influencers love our shoes! 


 


The Opportunity


 


We are looking for retail ambassadors who can communicate passionately about the Baudoin and Lange brand and provide visitors of our first central physical UK location with an amazing try-on experience. This position will be based in our Burlington Arcade pop up, near Piccadilly station. Your primary work location will be on the sales floor of London’s Historical Landmark, this area is a major tourist destination and a vibrant, multicultural gathering place in Central London. 


 


This is an opportunity for those who thrive in a fast-paced environment, see themselves as more than a Sales Associate but as a true personal ‘advisor’- someone who is seeking to grow their career in the luxury retail environment, has a strategic sales mindset, willingness to learn and a passion for forming meaningful relationships with a global clientele. As we value forward thinking individuals, we welcome someone who is eager to contribute their creativity and skill set to continue the success and strong heritage of the brand.

In order to be successful in this role you must be someone who has experience working in a luxury or high end retail environment or has a strong history involving customer service, dealing with a diverse and elevated clientele. Someone who is motivated to continuously improve personal performance, works well in a team setting, possesses elevated interpersonal skills and the curiosity to discover and enhance the customer in-store experience.


 


This is an extraordinary opportunity to protect, enhance and strengthen our retail sales activity across current and future retail locations, and to take true ownership of our new store front.  In return, we offer a chance to work in a creative and fast-paced environment, directly with the founders, through which you’ll get exposure and insight into the luxury industry with a fresh perspective.


 


About You 


 


As our Sales Associate, you will be an ambassador of the Brand, ensuring that every Client is treated according to the Baudoin and Lange promise. You will strive to discover your Clients and their every need, and to guide them across the Brand. 


 


Requirements


 



  • Promote and drive the company culture

  • Ensure store operations are functioning properly, request for maintenance if needed.

  • Execute and delegate operational tasks and productivity

  • Communicate with Retail Ambassadors specific business communications and new products

  • Ensure proper visual merchandising standards on the retail floor and windows

  • Ensure all current product is exposed on retail floor

  • Ensure customer satisfaction and resolve point-of-sale discrepancies

  • Monitor stock levels and ensure Retail Ambassadors are filling shelves

  • Assist in sales and cashiering

  • Manage day to day operations of the store

  • Work closely with Head of Sales and Store Manager to optimize in-store offering and stock management to optimize sales


 


What kind of person are we looking for? 



  • Prior retail experience desired, ideally in fashion or footwear

  • Positive attitude and enthusiasm

  • Engaging relationship building with customers with the goal of every customer leaving with a smile

  • Connection to Baudoin and Lange’s philosophy and products

  • Pride of ownership with store appearance, cleanliness and organization

  • Willingness to go above and beyond

  • Once trained, use the POS system accurately to process sales

  • Actively contribute towards meeting and exceeding the team's sales goals

  • Have a ‘can-do’ attitude, flexibility, creativity and very hands-on

  • Have excellent communication skills and established experience in presenting to senior leadership

  • Proper presentation and tone-of-voice that corresponds with our brand image


 


What We Can Do For You



  • Competitive hourly wage

  • Team of positive, enthusiastic, and passionate people

  • Duration: Fixed term 3 month contract with option to convert to full-time and opportunity to grow within the company

  • Free pair of shoes!
